{{Infobox album | name = Chrome Dreams II | type = Studio | artist = [[Neil Young]] | cover = ChromeDreamsII.jpg | alt = | released = October 23, 2007 | recorded = 1988, 2007 | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Heartland rock]], [[country rock]], [[americana music|Americana]], [[hard rock]] | length = 66:19 | label = [[Reprise Records|Reprise]] | producer = Neil Young & [[Niko Bolas]] (as "The Volume Dealers") | chronology = [[Neil Young]] | prev_title = [[Live at Massey Hall 1971]] | prev_year = 2007 | next_title = [[Sugar Mountain – Live at Canterbury House 1968]] | next_year = 2008 }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[AllMusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web|author=Stephen Thomas Erlewine |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/chrome-dreams-ii-mw0000490769 |title=Chrome Dreams II - Neil Young | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date=2007-10-23 |accessdate=2015-06-03}} | rev2 = ''[[The Guardian]]'' | rev2Score = {{Rating|3|5}}{{cite web|author=Alexis Petridis |url=http://music.guardian.co.uk/pop/alexispetridis/story/0,,2188725,00.html |title=CD: Neil Young, Chrome Dreams II | Music | The Guardian |publisher=Music.guardian.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-06-03}} | rev3 = ''[[The Observer]]'' | rev3Score = {{Rating|5|5}}{{cite web|author=Tim Adams |url=http://music.guardian.co.uk/rock/reviews/story/0,,2190098,00.html |title=CD: Neil Young, Chrome Dreams II/Bruce Springsteen, Magic | Music | The Guardian |publisher=Music.guardian.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-06-03}} | rev4 = ''[[The Times]]'' | rev4Score = {{Rating|3|5}}{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/cd_reviews/article2687078.ece |title=Neil Young: Chrome Dreams II review | CD reviews | Music - Times Online |publisher=Web.archive.org |date= |accessdate=2015-06-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080708225006/http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/cd_reviews/article2687078.ece |archivedate=July 8, 2008 }} | rev5 = [[Pitchfork Media]] | rev5Score = (5.6/10){{cite web|url=http://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/10792-chrome-dreams-ii/ |title=Neil Young: Chrome Dreams II | Album Reviews |publisher=Pitchfork |date=2007-10-17 |accessdate=2015-06-03}} | rev6 = ''[[The Independent]]'' | rev6Score = {{Rating|2|5}}{{cite web|url=http://arts.independent.co.uk/music/reviews/article3073848.ece |title=Album: Neil Young - Independent Online Edition > Reviews |publisher=Web.archive.org |date= |accessdate=2015-06-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071224021421/http://arts.independent.co.uk/music/reviews/article3073848.ece |archivedate=December 24, 2007 }} | rev7 = ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' | rev7Score = {{Rating|3|5}}{{cite web|last=Christgau |first=Robert |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/chrome-dreams-ii-20071101 |title=Neil Young Chrome Dreams II Album Review |publisher=Rolling Stone |date=2007-11-01 |accessdate=2015-06-03}} | rev8 = [[NME]] | rev8Score = (7/10)NME, 10/27/2007, p.41 | rev9 = ''[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]]'' | rev9Score = {{Rating|7|10}} {{cite web|last=Weiss |first=Dan |url=http://www.spin.com/reviews/neil-young-chrome-dreams-ii-reprise |title=Neil Young, ‘Chrome Dreams II’ (Reprise) |publisher=SPIN |date=2008-01-18 |accessdate=2015-06-03}} | rev10 = ''[[Uncut (magazine)|Uncut]]'' | rev10Score = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web|url=http://www.uncut.co.uk/music/neil_young/reviews/10593 |title=Neil Young - Chrome Dreams II - Review - Uncut.co.uk |publisher=Web.archive.org |date= |accessdate=2015-06-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080726182129/http://uncut.co.uk/music/neil_young/reviews/10593 |archivedate=July 26, 2008 }} }} '''''Chrome Dreams II''''' is the 28th studio album by Canadian musician [[Neil Young]]. The album was released on October 23, 2007 as a double LP and as a single CD. The album is a sequel to ''[[Chrome Dreams]]'', a legendary Neil Young album from 1977 that had originally been scheduled for release but was shelved in favor of ''[[American Stars 'N Bars]]''.{{cite web |url=http://neilyoung.com/news/index.html |title=Neil Young Times |publisher=Neilyoung.com |date= |accessdate=2015-06-03 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071201092807/http://www.neilyoung.com/news/index.html |archive-date=2007-12-01 |dead-url=yes |df= }} The album debuted on the U.S. [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart at number 11, selling about 54,000 copies in its first week.{{cite web | url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1047534/underwood-leads-three-country-debuts-onto-chart | title= Underwood Leads Three Country Debuts Onto Chart | accessdate= 2007-11-28 | last= Hasty | first= Katie | date= 2007-10-31 | publisher= Billboard.com}} In addition, the song "No Hidden Path" was nominated for a [[Grammy Award]] for [[Best Solo Rock Vocal Performance]] at the 51st Grammy Awards, 2009.{{cite web|last=Weiss |first=Dan |url=http://www.spin.com/2009/02/its-not-your-parents-grammy-awards-or-it/ |title=It’s Not Your Parents’ Grammy Awards — Or Is It? |publisher=SPIN |date=2009-02-06 |accessdate=2015-06-03}} ==Production== ''Chrome Dreams II'' was produced by The Volume Dealers (Neil Young & [[Niko Bolas]]), and features the ensemble of [[Crazy Horse (band)|Crazy Horse]] drummer [[Ralph Molina]], pedal steel guitarist and dobro player [[Ben Keith]] (''[[Harvest (Neil Young album)|Harvest]]'', ''[[Comes A Time]]'', ''[[Harvest Moon (album)|Harvest Moon]]'') and bassist [[Rick Rosas]] (''[[Freedom (Neil Young album)|Freedom]]'', ''[[Living With War]]'', ''[[This Note's for You]]''). A horn section, The Blue Note Horns, appear on one track, "Ordinary People," while the [[Young People’s Chorus of New York City]] appear on "The Way." Most of the recording was done live with few overdubs at Feelgood's Garage studio near Redwood City, California, with two vintage gas pumps out front and vintage studio gear inside.{{cite web | url= http://bad-news-beat.org/ | title= Neil Young - Chrome Dreams II. and Live Archives coming up - Ordinary People | accessdate= 2007-11-28 | publisher= Bad News Beat}} According to Young,
It's an album with a form based on some of my original recordings, with a large variety of songs, rather than one specific type of song. Where ''[[Living with War]]'' and ''[[Everybody's Rockin']]'' were albums focused on one subject or style, ''Chrome Dreams II'' is more like ''[[After the Gold Rush]]'' or ''Freedom'', with different types of songs working together to form a feeling. Now that radio formats are not as influential as they once were, it's easier to release an album that crosses all formats with a message that runs through the whole thing, regardless of the type of song or sound. Some early listeners have said that this album is positive and spiritual. I like to think it focuses on the human condition. Like many of my recordings, this one draws on earlier material here and there. I used to do that a lot back in the day. Some songs, like 'Ordinary People,' need to wait for the right time. I think now is the right time for that song and it lives well with the new songs I have written in the past few months. I had a blast making this music.{{cite web | url= http://biz.yahoo.com/iw/070823/0294131.html | title= New Neil Young Album: "Chrome Dreams II" Set for Release October 16th | accessdate= 2007-11-28 | publisher= Warner Bros. Records}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}
The first three songs of ''Chrome Dreams II'' date from the 1980s. "Beautiful Bluebird" was first recorded for the original version of ''[[Old Ways]]'' that was shelved by Geffen Records; "Boxcar" was a track on the unreleased ''Times Square'' album, which was scrapped in favor of the more commercially viable ''[[Freedom (Neil Young album)|Freedom]]''; and "Ordinary People," which was recorded in summer 1988 for what became the ''[[Freedom (Neil Young album)|Freedom]]'' album, was highly regarded as one of Young's greatest unreleased songs, and was often played live during the "Sponsored By Nobody" tour with The Bluenotes to promote the album. This was the album's first single, and was sent to radio on Monday, September 10. The length of this track (clocking in at 18:13) makes it hard to program into today's limited radio playlists, so it was initially heard on radio web sites.{{cite web | url= http://neilyoung.com/news/index.html | title= Ordinary People to Radio | accessdate= 2007-11-28 | publisher= NY Times | archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20071201092807/http://www.neilyoung.com/news/index.html | archive-date= 2007-12-01 | dead-url= yes | df= }} ==Track listing== {{Track listing | all_writing = | title1 = Beautiful Bluebird | note1 = | length1 = 4:27 | title2 = Boxcar | note2 = | length2 = 2:44 | title3 = Ordinary People | note3 = | length3 = 18:12 | title4 = Shining Light | note4 = | length4 = 4:43 | title5 = The Believer | note5 = | length5 = 2:38 | title6 = Spirit Road | note6 = | length6 = 6:32 | title7 = Dirty Old Man | note7 = | length7 = 3:17 | title8 = Ever After | note8 = | length8 = 3:31 | title9 = No Hidden Path | note9 = | length9 = 14:31 | title10 = The Way | note10 = | length10 = 5:14 | title11 = | length11 = | title12 = | length12 = | title13 = | length13 = | title14 = | length14 = | title15 = | length15 = | title16 = | length16 = | title17 = | length17 = | title18 = | length18 = | title19 = | length19 = | title20 = | length20 = | total_length = }} ==Personnel== ===Primary musicians=== * [[Neil Young]] - [[acoustic guitar|acoustic]] & [[electric guitar]]s, [[banjo]], [[harmonica]], [[grand piano]], [[pump organ]], [[Hammond B-3 organ]], [[vibraphone|vibes]], [[percussion]], [[vocal]] * [[Ben Keith]] - [[pedal steel guitar]], [[lap slide guitar]], [[Dobro]], electric guitar, Hammond B-3 organ, vocal * [[Rick Rosas]] - [[bass guitar]], vocal * [[Ralph Molina]] - [[Drum kit|drums]], percussion, vocal ===Musicians for "Ordinary People"=== * Neil Young - electric guitar, vocal * [[Neil Young|Joe Canuck]] - vocal * [[Frank Sampedro|Frank "Poncho" Sampedro]] - guitar * Rick Rosas - bass guitar * [[Chad Cromwell]] - drums * [[Ben Keith]] - [[alto saxophone]] * Steve Lawrence - [[tenor saxophone]], [[keyboards]] * Larry Cragg - [[baritone saxophone]] * Claude Cailliet - [[trombone]] * [[John Fumo]] - [[trumpet]] * Tom Bray - trumpet (solo) ===Background singers=== * The Wyatt Earps - Ben Keith, Ralph Molina, Neil Young * The Jane Wyatts - Nancy Hall, Annie Stocking, [[Pegi Young]] * The Dirty Old Men - Larry Cragg, Ben Keith, Ralph Molina, Rick Rosas, Neil Young ==="The Way" choir=== [[The Young People’s Chorus of New York City]] * [[Francisco J. Núñez]], Artistic Director/Founder * Elizabeth Núñez, Conductor ====Choristers==== * Rebecca Shaw * Vera Kahn * Moraima Avalos * William Cabiniss * Che Elliott * Rosa Loveszy * Christina Lu * Jamal Marcelin * Lluvia Perez * Owen Smith * Julie Urena * Emily Viola * Reginald Wilson * Catherine McGough * Helen Parzick ==See also== * [[Chrome Dreams]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Neil Young}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chrome Dreams Ii}} [[Category:Neil Young albums]] [[Category:2007 albums]] [[Category:Reprise Records albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Neil Young]] [[Category:Albums produced by Niko Bolas]] [[Category:Sequel albums]]

{{Redirect|DC Movie Universe|the series of direct-to-video animated films|DC Animated Movie Universe}}{{short description|American superhero film franchise based on DC Comics}} {{Use mdy dates|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox film | name = DC Extended Universe | image = DC Comics logo.svg | caption = The official branding logo of all
DC Comics media | based on = {{based on|Characters published|[[DC Comics]]}} | starring = ''[[#Recurring cast and characters|See below]]'' | studio = | distributor = [[Warner Bros. Pictures]] | released = 2013–present | country = United States | language = English | budget = '''Total (5 films):'''
$1.100 billion | gross = '''Total (5 films):'''
$3.768 billion | italic title = no }} The '''DC Extended Universe''' ('''DCEU'''){{efn|Upon announcement of the film series, the universe was commonly called the "DC Cinematic Universe" by fans and the media, in keeping with the naming convention of the already established [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU).{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/merrillbarr/2014/04/09/will-warner-brothers-dc-ever-catch-up-to-marvel-television-after-last-nights-agents-of-s-h-i-e-l-d/ |title=Will Warner Brothers & DC Ever Catch Up To Marvel Television After Last Night's 'Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.'? |work=[[Forbes]] |date=April 9, 2014 |accessdate=March 29, 2018 |first=Merrill |last=Barr}}{{cite web |url=https://www.yahoo.com/movies/video/dc-cinematic-universe-launched-small-034445140.html |title=DC Cinematic Universe Launched From Small Screen? – It's A Wrap! |publisher=[[Yahoo!]] |date=August 12, 2013 |accessdate=May 25, 2014}}{{cite web |last=Franich |first=Darren |url=http://ew.com/article/2014/08/14/dc-movies-batman-superman-response/ |title=Entertainment Geekly: Your thoughts on the DC Cinematic Universe |date=August 14, 2014 |accessdate=May 8, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} Keith Staskiewicz, writing for ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'', coined the term "DC Extended Universe™" as a joke on an article of his about ''[[Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice]]'' on July 1, 2015. This and the abbreviation DCEU quickly spread among the press and fans thinking of it as the official name of the franchise over the following years.{{cite journal |title=They Are Legend |last=Nathan |first=Ian |journal=[[Empire (film magazine)|Empire]] |publisher=[[Bauer Media Group]] |issue=September 2015 |pages=77–89 (80 for cited material)}} According to ''[[Vulture.com|Vulture]]'' writer Abraham Riesman, DC confirmed to him in September 2017 that the term is not used internally and they do not consider it official. In 2016, as part of ''DC Films Presents: Dawn of the Justice League'', both Geoff Johns and [[Kevin Smith]] referred to the franchise's name as being the "Justice League Universe". During the [[DC Films]] panel at [[San Diego Comic-Con]] 2018, a video banner displayed the words "Welcome to the Worlds of DC", after showcasing some upcoming films. As a result, some media outlets interpreted this as DC officially naming their shared film universe as the "Worlds of DC".{{cite web |url=https://screenrant.com/dc-extended-universe-officially-branded-worlds-dc/ |title=The DC Extended Universe Labelled 'Worlds of DC' At Comic-Con [UPDATED] |last=Shaw-Williams |first=Hannah |date=July 21, 2018 |website=ScreenRant |access-date=October 4, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/markhughes/2018/07/22/aquaman-trailer-shows-great-chance-for-revival-of-dc-movies/#21fc30b17633 |title='Aquaman' Trailer Shows Great Chance For Revival Of DC Movies |last=Hughes |first=Mark |date=July 22, 2018 |website=[[Forbes]] |access-date=October 4, 2018}} Despite this, there has been no official announcement from Warner Bros. nor DC Films to confirm this.}} is a term used to refer to an American [[media franchise]] and [[shared universe]] that is centered on a [[film series|series]] of [[superhero film]]s, distributed by [[Warner Bros. Pictures]] and based on characters that appear in [[American comic book]]s by [[DC Comics]]. The shared universe, much like the original [[DC Universe]] in comic books and the [[Arrowverse|television programs]], was established by [[fictional crossover|crossing over]] common plot elements, settings, cast, and characters. The films have been in production since 2011 and in that time Warner Bros. has distributed five films. The series has grossed over $3.7 billion at the global box office, currently making it the [[List of highest-grossing franchises and film series|fourteenth highest-grossing film franchise]]. The films are written and directed by a variety of individuals and feature large, often [[Ensemble cast|ensemble]], casts. Several actors, including [[Henry Cavill]], [[Amy Adams]], [[Ben Affleck]], [[Gal Gadot]], [[Ezra Miller]], [[Jason Momoa]], and [[Ray Fisher (actor)|Ray Fisher]], have appeared in numerous films of the franchise, with continued appearances in sequels planned. In May 2016, DC's [[chief creative officer]] [[Geoff Johns]] and Warner Bros. executive vice president Jon Berg were appointed to co-run the [[DC Films]] division and oversee creative decisions, production and [[Story arc|story-arcs]] in order to create a cohesive overarching plot within the films. In January 2018, [[Walter Hamada]] was appointed the president of DC Films, replacing Berg. The first film in the DCEU was ''[[Man of Steel (film)|Man of Steel]]'' (2013) followed by ''[[Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice]]'' (2016), ''[[Suicide Squad (film)|Suicide Squad]]'' (2016), ''[[Wonder Woman (2017 film)|Wonder Woman]]'' (2017), ''[[Justice League (film)|Justice League]]'' (2017), and ''[[Aquaman (film)|Aquaman]]'' (2018). The franchise will continue with scheduled release dates for ''[[Shazam! (film)|Shazam!]]'' in 2019, as well as ''[[DC Extended Universe#Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of one Harley Quinn) (2020)|Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of one Harley Quinn)]]'' and ''[[Wonder Woman 1984]]'' scheduled for release in 2020. A multitude of other projects are in various stages of development. == Development == [[File:Geoff Johns by Gage Skidmore.jpg|thumb|left|Geoff Johns, who has held a variety of positions involved with DC Films and the DC Extended Universe since 2016]] In 2002, [[Wolfgang Petersen]] was set to direct a ''[[Superman in film#Batman vs. Superman (2001–2002)|Batman vs. Superman]]'' film from a script by [[Akiva Goldsman]].{{cite web |last=Ahmed |first=Tufayel |url=http://www.newsweek.com/story-how-batman-v-superman-almost-happened-15-years-ago-440494 |title=The story of how 'Batman vs. Superman' almost happened 15 years ago |date=March 27, 2016 |accessdate=May 10, 2017 |work=[[Newsweek]]}} Warner Bros. canceled development to focus on individual Superman and Batman projects after [[J. J. Abrams]] submitted another draft for ''Superman: Flyby''.{{cite book |author=David Hughes |title=Tales From Development Hell |isbn=1-84023-691-4 |publisher=[[Titan Books]] |pages=205–8 |year=2003}}{{cite news |author=Brian Jacks |url=http://splashpage.mtv.com/2010/03/15/christian-bale-superman-wolfgang-petersen-batman-vs-superman/ |title=Exclusive: Christian Bale Met For Superman Role In Wolfgang Petersen's 'Batman Vs. Superman' |work=[[MTV News]] |date=March 15, 2010 |accessdate=March 24, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203092314/http://splashpage.mtv.com/2010/03/15/christian-bale-superman-wolfgang-petersen-batman-vs-superman/ |archivedate=December 3, 2013 |df=mdy-all}} In February 2007, Warner Bros. hired husband and wife duo Michele and [[Kieran Mulroney]] to write a script for a ''[[Justice League]]'' film.{{cite news |last1=McClintock |first1=Pamela |last2=Fritz |first2=Ben |title='Justice' prevails for Warner Bros. |url=https://variety.com/2007/film/markets-festivals/justice-prevails-for-warner-bros-1117960018/ |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=February 22, 2007 |accessdate=May 10, 2017}} [[Christian Bale]], who starred as Batman in ''[[Batman Begins]]'' (2005), was not approached to reprise the role,{{cite news |first=Rachel |last=Howard |title=Interview: Is Christian Bale In or Out of WB’s 'Justice League'? |url=http://www.iesb.net/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=3109&Itemid=99 |work=IESB |date=August 21, 2007 |accessdate=November 1, 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080315113105/http://www.iesb.net/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=3109&Itemid=99 |archivedate=March 15, 2008}} nor was [[Brandon Routh]], who starred as Superman in ''[[Superman Returns]]'' (2006).{{cite news |author=Frosty |url=http://www.collider.com/entertainment/interviews/article.asp/aid/7675/tcid/1 |website=[[Collider (website)|Collider]] |title=Brandon Routh Exclusive Video Interview – ''Lie To Me'' |date=April 23, 2008 |accessdate=November 1, 2008}} [[George Miller (director)|George Miller]] was hired to direct the film,{{cite news |first=Diane |last=Garrett |url=https://variety.com/2007/film/features/george-miller-to-lead-justice-league-2-1117972369/69 |title=George Miller to lead ''Justice League'' |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=September 20, 2007 |accessdate=September 20, 2007}} reportedly titled ''Justice League Mortal'',{{cite news |first=Michaela |last=Boland |url=https://variety.com/2008/film/awards/rebates-requirements-rattle-industry-1117983793/ |title=Rebates' requirements rattle industry |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=April 9, 2008 |accessdate=May 9, 2017}} with [[Armie Hammer]] cast as Batman, [[D. J. Cotrona]] as Superman, [[Adam Brody]] as Flash, [[Santiago Cabrera]] as Aquaman, [[Common (rapper)|Common]] as Green Lantern, [[Megan Gale]] as Wonder Woman, [[Hugh Keays-Byrne]] as [[Martian Manhunter]] and [[Jay Baruchel]] as [[Maxwell Lord]].{{cite web |last=Robinson |first=Will |url=http://ew.com/article/2015/11/20/justice-league-megan-gale-wonder-woman/ |title=Justice League: Megan Gale as Wonder Woman pics surface |date=November 20, 2015 |accessdate=May 10, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} The project was put on indefinite hold in January 2008, after failing to secure [[tax breaks]] for filming in Australia, as well as the [[2007–2008 Writers Guild of America strike]] preventing progress on the script.{{cite web |last1=Fleming |first1=Michael |last2=Garrett |first2=Diane |url=https://variety.com/2008/film/news/warner-pulls-plug-on-justice-league-1117979189/ |title=Warner pulls plug on 'Justice League' |date=January 16, 2008 |accessdate=May 10, 2017 |work=Variety}} In 2013, a [[Reboot (fiction)|reboot]] of the [[Superman in film|''Superman'' franchise]], ''[[Man of Steel (film)|Man of Steel]]'', was set to lay the groundwork for future DC films.{{cite web |last=Breznican |first=Anthony |url=http://ew.com/article/2013/04/11/man-of-steel-dc-comics-superhero-movies/ |title='Man of Steel' will open door for more DC Comics superhero movies |date=April 11, 2013 |accessdate=May 24, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} The film contained references to other characters in the [[DC Universe]], so if it were a success, it could launch a shared universe.{{cite web |last=Connelly |first=Brendon |url=http://www.bleedingcool.com/2013/06/13/david-goyer-tells-me-how-man-of-steels-story-causes-the-justice-league-movie/ |title=David Goyer Tells Me How Man Of Steel Will "Cause" The Justice League Movie |website=[[Bleeding Cool]] |date=June 13, 2013 |accessdate=May 9, 2017}}{{cite web |last=Dyce |first=Andrew |url=http://screenrant.com/superman-man-of-steel-shared-universe/ |title=Man of Steel Will Launch DC Shared Universe |website=[[Screen Rant]] |date=April 11, 2013 |accessdate=August 20, 2016}} Days before ''Man of Steel''{{'}}s release in June, it was reported that director [[Zack Snyder]] and screenwriter [[David S. Goyer]] would be returning for a sequel, which was being fast-tracked by Warner Bros. In July, at [[San Diego Comic-Con]], it was revealed that the sequel would include Batman in a main role, thus establishing the shared universe. In October 2014, Warner Bros. announced a slate of ten DC films. While the rival [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) includes television productions, the DC's new crossover film series is a shared continuity for films. Several television series featuring DC characters and storylines have their own shared continuity, frequently referred to as the [[Arrowverse]].{{cite web |last=Jensen |first=Jeff |url=http://ew.com/article/2016/11/09/flash-green-arrow-supergirl-cw-superheroes-crossover-cover/ |title=This Week's Cover: CW superheroes crossover revealed |date=November 9, 2016 |accessdate=May 25, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} DC's [[chief creative officer]] [[Geoff Johns]] explained DC's difference in approach to [[Marvel Studios]] and their cinematic universe, saying, "We look at it as the [[multiverse]]. We have our TV universe and our film universe, but they all co-exist. For us, creatively, it’s about allowing everyone to make the best possible product, to tell the best story, to do the best world. Everyone has a vision and you really want to let the visions shine through ... It's just a different approach."{{cite web |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/jarettwieselman/the-man-at-the-center-of-dcs-tv-multiverse |title=The Man At The Center Of DC’s TV Multiverse |last=Wieselman |first=Jarett |work=BuzzFeed |date=October 23, 2014 |accessdate=October 30, 2014}} In June 2015, Warner Bros. president of creative development Greg Silverman expanded on DC's approach to their cinematic universe, saying, "We ... take these beloved characters and put them in the hands of master filmmakers and make sure they all coordinate with each other. You'll see the difference when you see ... the things that we are working on."{{cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/warner-bros-film-chief-wonder-799408 |title=Warner Bros. Film Chief on 'Wonder Woman,' J.K. Rowling's 'Fantastic Beasts' Script and How DC Will Compete With Marvel |last=McClintock |first=Pamela |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=June 3, 2015 |accessdate=June 3, 2015}} In May 2016, following criticism of ''Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice'', Warner Bros. established a DC Films division with Geoff Johns and Warner Bros. executive vice president Jon Berg as its heads,{{cite news |url=http://www.vulture.com/2016/05/geoff-johns-dc-films.html |title=The New Co-Chief of DC Superhero Movies Is Big On Hope and Optimism |last=Riesman |first=Abraham |work=Vulture |date=May 18, 2016 |accessdate=May 27, 2016}} which oversees production to form a cohesive creative direction for the franchise.{{cite news |title='Batman v. Superman' Fallout: Warner Bros. Shakes Up Executive Roles (Exclusive) |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/batman-v-superman-fallout-warner-895174 |last=Kit |first=Borys |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=May 17, 2016 |accessdate=May 27, 2016}}{{cite news |url=http://deadline.com/2016/05/dc-films-batman-v-superman-geoff-johns-jon-berg-1201758630/ |title=Warner Bros Responding To Fans & Critics With DC Films Shakeup |last=Lincoln |first=Ross |work=Deadline Hollywood |date=May 17, 2016 |accessdate=May 27, 2016}} DC Films will not be fully autonomous, with Johns reporting to DC president [[Diane Nelson (comics)|Diane Nelson]] and Berg reporting to Silverman. [[Charles Roven]] was also moved from his day-by-day producer role on future DC films, which he had served since 2005's ''Batman Begins'', to an administrative executive producer role.{{cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/batman-v-superman-fallout-producer-897071 |title='Batman v. Superman' Fallout: Producer Charles Roven to Shift Role on DC Movies (Exclusive) |last=Kit |first=Borys |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=May 24, 2016 |accessdate=May 27, 2016}} In December, Silverman was ousted from his role in Warner Bros., and [[Toby Emmerich]] was promoted to president and chief content officer, in his place.{{cite web |last=Lang |first=Brent |url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/toby-emmerich-named-warner-bros-chief-content-officer-greg-silverman-ousted-1201942510/ |title=Toby Emmerich Named Warner Bros. Chief Content Officer, Greg Silverman Ousted |date=December 14, 2016 |accessdate=May 9, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} By January 2017, Johns and Berg reported to Emmerich.{{cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/green-lantern-corps-writers-david-goyer-justin-rhodes-1201959340/ |title=DC's 'Green Lantern Corps' Finds Writers in David Goyer, Justin Rhodes |date=January 12, 2017 |accessdate=May 9, 2017 |work=Variety}} Following the financial and critical success of ''[[Wonder Woman (2017 film)|Wonder Woman]]'' in June 2017, Johns stated that moving forward the films will focus on the heart, humor, hope, heroics, and optimism of the characters.{{cite web |last=Gonzalez |first=Umberto |url=http://www.thewrap.com/dc-extended-universe-wonder-woman-geoff-johns/ |title='Wonder Woman' and the 5 Words That Saved DC Movies From Darkness (Exclusive) |date=June 13, 2017 |accessdate=June 13, 2017 |website=[[TheWrap]]}} DC also decided to begin deemphasizing the shared nature of their films, with Diane Nelson stating, "Our intention, certainly, moving forward is using the continuity to help make sure nothing is diverging in a way that doesn't make sense, but there's no insistence upon an overall story line or interconnectivity in that universe... Moving forward, you'll see the DC movie universe being a universe, but one that comes from the heart of the filmmaker who's creating them."{{Cite web |url=http://www.vulture.com/2017/09/dc-wonder-woman-movie-strategy-universe.html |title=DC Rethinks Its Universe |last=Riesman |first=Abraham |access-date=October 4, 2018}} As a result of ''[[Justice League (film)|Justice League]]'''s underperformance at the box office, Berg left his position by January 2018 and became a production partner with [[Roy Lee]].{{cite web |last=Lang |first=Brent |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/dc-films-justice-league-1202632214/ |title=DC Shake-Up After ''Justice League'' Stumbles (EXCLUSIVE) |date=December 7, 2017 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=December 7, 2017}} In January 2018, [[Walter Hamada]] was appointed the President of DC Films and the new co-runner of the DCEU, replacing Berg.{{cite web |last=Lang |first=Brent |url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/warner-bros-taps-walter-hamada-to-oversee-dc-films-production-exclusive-1202652878/ |title=Warner Bros. Taps Walter Hamada to Oversee DC Films Production (Exclusive) |date=January 4, 2018 |accessdate=March 29, 2018 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]}} The following month, Chantal Nong was hired as Vice President of the film studio, additionally overseeing the production of the franchise.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/dc-films-taps-chantal-nong-key-production-role-1086317 |title=DC Films Taps Chantal Nong for Key Production Role (Exclusive) |date=February 20, 2018 |accessdate=March 13, 2018 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} The pair were hired to oversee the future of the franchise with Johns, as the key production team managers. However, in June of the same year, Johns stepped down from his role as co-head of DC Films and co-runner of the DCEU. He will remain with the studio as co-chairman, while starting his own studio where he will take on a greater hands-on role with film media as a producer and screenwriter. His production company, Mad Ghost Productions, will produce future films in the franchise, as well as comic book and television media.{{cite news |last1=Lang |first1=Brent |title=Geoff Johns Exiting as DC Entertainment President and Chief Creative Officer |url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/geoff-johns-exiting-as-dc-entertainment-president-1202840461/ |accessdate=June 13, 2018 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=June 11, 2018}} == Films == {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center; width:100%;" |- ! scope="column" style="width:12%"| Film ! U.S. release date ! Director(s) ! Screenwriter(s) ! Story by ! Producer(s) |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[Man of Steel (film)|Man of Steel]]'' | style="text-align:center" | {{Start date|2013|6|14}} | rowspan=2 | [[Zack Snyder]] | [[David S. Goyer]] | David S. Goyer & [[Christopher Nolan]] | [[Charles Roven]], Christopher Nolan, [[Emma Thomas]] and [[Deborah Snyder]] |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice|Batman v Superman:
{{small|Dawn of Justice}}]]'' | style="text-align:center" | {{Start date|2016|3|25}} | colspan=2 | [[Chris Terrio]] and David S. Goyer | Charles Roven and Deborah Snyder |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[Suicide Squad (film)|Suicide Squad]]'' | style="text-align:center" | {{Start date|2016|8|5}} | colspan="3" | [[David Ayer]] | Charles Roven and [[Richard Suckle]] |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[Wonder Woman (2017 film)|Wonder Woman]]'' | style="text-align:center" | {{Start date|2017|6|2}} | [[Patty Jenkins]] | [[Allan Heinberg]] | Zack Snyder & Allan Heinberg and [[Jason Fuchs]] | Charles Roven, Deborah Snyder, Zack Snyder and Richard Suckle |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[Justice League (film)|Justice League]]'' | style="text-align:center" | {{Start date|2017|11|17}} | Zack Snyder | Chris Terrio and [[Joss Whedon]] | Chris Terrio & Zack Snyder | Charles Roven, Deborah Snyder, Jon Berg and [[Geoff Johns]] |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[Aquaman (film)|Aquaman]]'' | style="text-align:center" | {{Start date|2018|12|21}} | [[James Wan]] | [[David Leslie Johnson-McGoldrick]] and [[Will Beall]] | Geoff Johns & James Wan and Will Beall | [[Peter Safran]] and Rob Cowan |} [[File:Zack Snyder by Gage Skidmore 2.jpg|thumb|150px|Zack Snyder: the director of ''Man of Steel'' and ''Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice''; co-story writer and director of ''Justice League''; and co-story writer of ''Wonder Woman'']] === ''Man of Steel'' (2013) === {{Main|Man of Steel (film)}} [[Superman|Kal-El / Clark Kent]], who arrived on Earth years ago as an infant from [[Krypton (comics)|Krypton]], struggles with why he was sent to Earth. Raised by his adoptive parents, [[Jonathan and Martha Kent]], Clark adopts the persona "[[Superman]]", and learns if his abilities are meant to maintain peace or conquer the world.{{cite web |url=http://collider.com/superman-man-of-steel-plot-synopsis/ |title=Plot Synopsis for MAN OF STEEL |last=Goldberg |first=Matt |website=[[Collider (website)|Collider]] |date=August 17, 2011 |accessdate=July 31, 2015}} During story discussions for ''[[The Dark Knight Rises]]'', [[David S. Goyer]] told [[Christopher Nolan]] his idea regarding how to present Superman in a modern context.{{cite web |last=Oldham |first=Stuart |url=https://variety.com/2010/film/news/nolan-no-joker-in-next-batman-8328/ |title=Nolan: No Joker in next 'Batman' |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=June 4, 2010 |accessdate=June 2, 2017}} Impressed with Goyer's concept, Nolan pitched the idea to the studio,{{cite web |last=Boucher |first=Geoff |url=http://herocomplex.latimes.com/movies/christopher-nolan-takes-flight-with-superman-we-have-a-fantastic-story-1/ |title=Christopher Nolan takes flight with Superman: 'We have a fantastic story' |date=March 10, 2010 |accessdate=June 2, 2017 |work=[[Los Angeles Times]]}} who hired Nolan to produce and Goyer to write based on the financial and critical success of ''[[The Dark Knight (film)|The Dark Knight]]''.{{cite news |last=Finke |first=Nikki |last2=Fleming |first2=Mike |title=It's A Bird! It's A Plane! It's Chris Nolan! He'll Mentor Superman 3.0 And Prep 3rd Batman |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=February 9, 2010 |url=http://deadline.com/2010/02/its-a-bird-its-a-plane-its-chris-nolan-hell-mentor-superman-3-0-while-preparing-3rd-batman-24783/ |accessdate=December 3, 2010 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5xLwx0v1Q?url=http://www.deadline.com/2010/02/its-a-bird-its-a-plane-its-chris-nolan-hell-mentor-superman-3-0-while-preparing-3rd-batman/ |archivedate=March 21, 2011 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy}}{{cite news |first=Lauren A. E. |last=Schuker |title=Warner Bets on Fewer, Bigger Movies |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |date=August 22, 2008 |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB121936107614461929 |accessdate=October 22, 2008 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5xLzZSe7O?url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB121936107614461929.html |archivedate=March 21, 2011 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy}} [[Zack Snyder]] was hired in October 2010 to direct the film.{{cite news |url=http://www.deadline.com/2010/10/zack-snyder-directing-superman/ |title=SCOOP: Zack Snyder Directing ''Superman'' |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |last=Fleming |first=Michael |date=October 4, 2010 |accessdate=October 4, 2010}} In January 2011, [[Henry Cavill]] was cast as Clark Kent / Superman.{{cite web |last=Bierly |first=Mandi |url=http://ew.com/article/2011/01/30/superman-cast-henry-cavill/ |title=Superman found: 'Tudors' star Henry Cavill cast |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |date=January 30, 2011 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} Other cast members included [[Amy Adams]] as [[Lois Lane]],{{cite web |last=Yuan |first=Annie |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/amy-adams-cast-as-lois-171760 |title=Amy Adams Cast as Lois Lane in Zack Snyder's 'Superman' |date=March 27, 2011 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} [[Michael Shannon]] as the villain [[General Zod]],{{cite web |last=Fleming Jr. |first=Mike |url=http://deadline.com/2011/04/toldja-michael-shannon-gets-villain-role-in-superman-121484/ |title=Toldja! Michael Shannon Gets Villain Role In Superman Movie |date=April 10, 2011 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]}} [[Diane Lane]] as Martha Kent,{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/diane-lane-play-supermans-mom-163527 |title=Diane Lane to Play 'Superman's' Mom Martha Kent |date=March 2, 2011 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} [[Kevin Costner]] as Jonathan Kent,{{cite web |last=Jensen |first=Jeff |url=http://ew.com/article/2011/03/17/kevin-costner-cast-in-superman/ |title=Kevin Costner officially cast in Zack Snyder's 'Superman' reboot |date=March 17, 2011 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} [[Russell Crowe]] as [[Jor-El]],{{cite web |last=Franich |first=Darren |url=http://ew.com/article/2011/06/15/russell-crowe-superman-jor-el/ |title=Russell Crowe: Superman's Jor-El? |date=June 15, 2011 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} and [[Laurence Fishburne]] as [[Perry White]].{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2011/08/laurence-fishburne-to-play-perry-white-in-man-of-steel-153005/ |title=Laurence Fishburne To Play Perry White In 'Man Of Steel' |date=August 2, 2011 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]}} [[Principal photography]] began on August 1, 2011.{{cite web |url=http://www.chicagobusiness.com/article/20110728/NEWS07/110729855/superman-flying-into-chicago-in-august-for-filming |first=Paul |last=Merrion |title=Superman flying into Chicago in August for filming |work=[[Crain's Chicago Business]] |date=July 28, 2011 |accessdate=July 29, 2011}} ''Man of Steel'' released in North America on June 14, 2013.{{cite web |last=Kilday |first=Gregg |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/zack-snyders-superman-movie-man-214005 |title=Zack Snyder's Superman Movie 'Man of Steel' Moved to June 14, 2013 |date=July 21, 2011 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} === ''Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice'' (2016) === {{Main|Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice}} [[Gotham City]]-based vigilante [[Batman]] travels to [[Metropolis (comics)|Metropolis]] to preemptively combat [[Superman]], fearing what would happen if the latter is kept unchecked, while another threat endangers humankind.{{cite web |url=http://collider.com/batman-vs-superman-synopsis-revealed/ |title=Batman vs. Superman Synopsis Revealed |work=Collider |accessdate=July 28, 2015}} In June 2013, it was reported that Snyder and Goyer would be returning for a sequel to ''Man of Steel'', which was being fast-tracked by Warner Bros. Nolan was involved in an advisory role as executive producer.{{cite web |last=Franich |first=Darren |url=http://ew.com/article/2016/01/27/zack-snyder-christopher-nolan-batman-v-superman/ |title=Batman v Superman: Zack Snyder asked Christopher Nolan for permission |date=January 27, 2016 |accessdate=May 25, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} In July, at the [[San Diego Comic-Con]], Warner Bros. announced that Superman and Batman would meet for the first time in a cinematic format in the film, which would be the follow-up to ''Man of Steel'' and a reboot of the [[Batman in film|''Batman'' film series]].{{cite news |last=Sperling |first=Nicole |url=http://herocomplex.latimes.com/movies/comic-con-2013-superman-batman-movie-will-follow-man-of-steel/ |title=Comic-Con 2013: 'Superman & Batman' movie will follow 'Man of Steel' |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=July 20, 2013 |accessdate=July 21, 2013}}{{cite web |last=Funich |first=Darren |url=http://ew.com/article/2013/07/20/dc-warner-bros-comic-con-superman-batman/ |title=Warner Bros. reveals plans for a Batman/Superman film |date=July 20, 2013 |accessdate=May 25, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} According to Snyder, the film took inspiration from the comic ''[[The Dark Knight Returns]]''.{{cite web |last=Anders |first=Charlie Jane |url=http://io9.com/theyre-doing-a-superman-batman-movie-but-thats-not-851711013 |title=They're doing a Superman/Batman movie... but that's not the big news |website=[[io9]] |date=July 20, 2013 |accessdate=July 22, 2013}} Cavill, Adams, Lane, and Fishburne reprised their roles. In August, [[Ben Affleck]] was cast as Bruce Wayne / Batman.{{cite news |last=Schillaci |first=Sophie |title=Ben Affleck Is Batman for 'Man of Steel' Sequel |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/ben-affleck-is-batman-man-612907 |accessdate=August 23, 2013 |newspaper=The Hollywood Reporter |date=August 22, 2013}} In December, [[Gal Gadot]] was cast as [[Wonder Woman|Diana Prince / Wonder Woman]], marking the character's first appearance in a live-action theatrical film.{{cite news |url=https://variety.com/2013/film/news/gal-gadot-wonder-woman-batman-vs-superman-1200918310/ |title=Gal Gadot to Play Wonder Woman in 'Batman vs. Superman' |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=December 4, 2013 |accessdate=December 4, 2013 |first=Justin |last=Kroll}} Later in the month, [[Chris Terrio]] was hired to rewrite Goyer's script.{{cite news |last=Siegel |first=Tatiana |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/batman-superman-chris-terrio-write-666735 |title=Batman-Superman Film Enlists 'Argo' Writer (Exclusive) |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=December 18, 2013 |accessdate=December 18, 2013}} In January 2014, the film was delayed from its July 17, 2015, release date to May 6, 2016, to give the filmmakers "time to realize fully their vision, given the complex visual nature of the story".{{cite news |last=Duke |first=Alan |url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/01/18/showbiz/batman-superman-movie-delayed/ |title=Batman-meets-Superman movie delayed a year; Peter Pan flies into its slot |publisher=CNN |date=January 18, 2014 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} Later that month, [[Jesse Eisenberg]] and [[Jeremy Irons]] joined the cast as [[Lex Luthor]] and [[Alfred Pennyworth]], respectively.{{cite web |url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20140131005753/en#.UuvjO9JDsk4 |title=Jesse Eisenberg and Jeremy Irons Join the Cast of Warner Bros. Pictures’ Untitled Superman/Batman Film from Director Zack Snyder |work=[[Business Wire]] |date=January 31, 2014 |accessdate=May 9, 2017}} In May 2014, the film's title was revealed to be ''Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice''.{{cite web |last=Siegel |first=Tatiana |last2=Kit |first2=Borys |title=Warner Bros. Unveils Title of New Batman-Superman Film |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/warner-bros-unveils-title-new-706231 |accessdate=May 22, 2014 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=May 21, 2014}} Initial filming occurred on October 19, 2013, at [[East Los Angeles College]],{{cite web |last=Acuna |first=Kirsten |title=The 'Batman Vs. Superman' Movie Is Filming This Weekend At A College Campus In LA |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/batman-vs-superman-will-film-at-east-los-angeles-college-2013-10 |accessdate=June 2, 2017 |work=[[Business Insider]] |date=October 15, 2013}} before full [[principal photography]] began on May 21, 2014, in [[Detroit]].{{cite web |last=Gettell |first=Oliver |url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesnow/la-et-mn-batman-v-superman-dawn-of-justice-starts-shooting-in-detroit-20140521-story.html |title='Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice' starts shooting in Detroit |date=May 21, 2014 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=[[Los Angeles Times]]}} Production also took place in [[Illinois]], [[New Mexico]], [[Africa]] and the South Pacific.{{cite web |last=Gomez |first=Adrian |url=https://www.abqjournal.com/508255/batman-v-superman-wraps-up-in-nm.html |title=Batman v Superman: It’s a wrap in New Mexico |date=December 10, 2014 |accessdate=May 27, 2017 |work=[[Albuquerque Journal]]}} After another date change, the film was released in North America on March 25, 2016.{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2014/08/batman-v-superman-new-release-date-warner-bros-dc-815462/ |title='Batman V. Superman' Moves Release Date Again As Warner Bros Sets DC Game Plan |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=August 6, 2014 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} The film is set 18 months after the events of ''Man of Steel''.{{cite web |last=Turan |first=Kenneth |url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-batman-superman-review-20160325-column.html |title='Batman v Superman,' with Ben Affleck and Henry Cavill, is a gritty superhero showdown |date=March 23, 2016 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=[[Los Angeles Times]]}} ''Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice'' introduced [[Ezra Miller]] as [[The Flash|Barry Allen / The Flash]],{{cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |title='The Flash' Movie to Star Ezra Miller in 2018 |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/the-flash-movie-ezra-miller-aquaman-jason-momoa-2018-1201330654/ |work=Variety |date=October 15, 2014 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} [[Jason Momoa]] as [[Aquaman|Arthur Curry / Aquaman]],{{cite web |last1=Ford |first1=Jessica |last2=Kit |first2=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/jason-momoa-playing-aquaman-batman-711899 |title=Jason Momoa to Play Aquaman in 'Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice' |date=June 16, 2014 |accessdate=May 6, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} [[Ray Fisher (actor)|Ray Fisher]] as [[Cyborg (comics)|Victor Stone / Cyborg]],{{cite news |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/batman-superman-cyborg-ray-fisher-1201163390/ |title=Ray Fisher to Play Cyborg In 'Batman-Superman' (Exclusive) |last=Kroll |first=Justin |work=Variety |date=April 24, 2014 |accessdate=April 24, 2014}} and [[Joe Morton]] as Dr. [[Silas Stone]].{{cite web |last=Breznican |first=Anthony |url=http://ew.com/article/2016/03/28/batman-v-superman-cyborg-scene-explained/ |title=Batman v Superman Cyborg scene explained — spoilers |date=March 28, 2016 |accessdate=April 4, 2018 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} The film also introduced [[Steppenwolf (comics)|Steppenwolf]], who served as the main antagonist in ''Justice League'', through a brief scene. The scene was not included in the film's theatrical release, but instead was revealed online by Warner Bros. on March 28,{{cite web |last=Breznican |first=Anthony |url=http://ew.com/article/2016/03/28/batman-v-superman-deleted-scene-steppenwolf/ |title=Batman v Superman deleted scene features new villain — spoiler alert |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |date=March 28, 2016 |accessdate=May 7, 2017}} before being included in the ''Ultimate Edition'' home video release.{{cite web |last=Valentine |first=Evan |url=http://collider.com/batman-vs-superman-ultimate-edition-differences/ |title='Batman v Superman': Theatrical Cut v Extended Cut – New Scenes Revealed in Detail |date=July 3, 2016 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |website=[[Collider (website)|Collider]]}} [[File:David Ayer by Gage Skidmore 2.jpg|thumb|left|150px|David Ayer: the writer and director of ''Suicide Squad'']] === ''Suicide Squad'' (2016) === {{Main|Suicide Squad (film)}} After the death of Superman, a secret government agency recruits imprisoned supervillains to execute dangerous black ops missions and rescue the world from a powerful threat, in exchange for clemency.{{cite news |url=http://screencrush.com/suicide-squad-plot-synopsis/ |title=New ‘Suicide Squad’ Plot Synopsis Reveals New Details About the Supervillain Movie |website=Screencrush.com |date=December 15, 2015 |accessdate=March 29, 2018}} In February 2009, prior to the development of the DCEU, Warner Bros. was developing a [[Suicide Squad]] film, with [[Dan Lin]] producing and Justin Marks writing the script.{{cite news |last=McNary |first=Dave |url=https://variety.com/2009/film/news/warner-bros-sets-up-suicide-squad-1118000590/ |title=Warner Bros. sets up 'Suicide Squad' |work=Variety |date=February 26, 2009 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} In October 2014, ''Suicide Squad'' was announced by Warner Bros., with [[David Ayer]] confirmed as director.{{cite web |last=Franich |first=Darren |url=http://ew.com/article/2014/10/15/justice-league-green-lantern-wonder-woman-flash-movies/ |title=Warner Bros. announces 10 DC movies, including 'Wonder Woman' |date=October 15, 2014 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} In December, it was revealed that Ayer would also be writing the screenplay.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/official-suicide-squad-star-will-753470 |title=It's Official: 'Suicide Squad' to Star Will Smith, Jared Leto, Margot Robbie and More |date=December 2, 2014 |accessdate=June 6, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} The main cast included [[Will Smith]] as [[Deadshot]], [[Margot Robbie]] as [[Harley Quinn]], [[Jared Leto]] as the [[Joker (comics)|Joker]], [[Jai Courtney]] as [[Captain Boomerang]], [[Jay Hernandez]] as [[El Diablo (comics)|El Diablo]], [[Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje]] as [[Killer Croc]], [[Karen Fukuhara]] as [[Katana (comics)|Katana]], [[Cara Delevingne]] as [[Enchantress (DC Comics)|Enchantress]], [[Viola Davis]] as [[Amanda Waller]], and [[Joel Kinnaman]] as [[Rick Flag]].{{cite web |last=Stedman |first=Alex |title='Suicide Squad': David Ayer Tweets First Photo of Cast in Costume |url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/suicide-squad-cast-photo-david-ayer-1201486433/ |date=May 3, 2015 |accessdate=May 6, 2017 |work=Variety}} [[Tom Hardy]] was originally cast as Rick Flag, but dropped out due to scheduling issues with his film ''[[The Revenant (2015 film)|The Revenant]]''.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/tom-hardy-drops-suicide-squad-764095 |title=Tom Hardy Drops Out of 'Suicide Squad' (Exclusive) |date=January 15, 2015 |accessdate=May 6, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} Principal photography commenced April 13, 2015,{{cite tweet |user=DavidAyerMovies |last=Ayer |first=David |authorlink=David Ayer |number=587710878100893696 |title=Day 1 #SuicideSquad |date=April 13, 2015 |accessdate=March 29, 2018}} and took place in and around [[Toronto]].{{cite news |last1=Vlessing |first1=Etan |title=David Ayer's 'Suicide Squad' to Shoot in Toronto For Warner Bros. |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/david-ayers-suicide-squad-shoot-753015 |accessdate=December 2, 2014 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=December 1, 2014}} Filming concluded August 28, 2015.{{cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/suicide-squad-david-ayer-tweets-cast-and-crew-photo-on-final-day-of-production-1201580769/ |title='Suicide Squad': David Ayer Tweets Cast and Crew Photo on Final Day of Production |work=Variety |date=August 28, 2015 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} ''Suicide Squad'' was released in North America on August 5, 2016. The film is set after the events of ''Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice''.{{cite web |last=McMillan |first=Graeme |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/suicide-squad-way-dc-movies-918447 |title=It's All Too Much: 'Suicide Squad' and the Way DC Movies Connect Together |date=August 9, 2016 |accessdate=May 30, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} Affleck as Bruce Wayne / Batman and Miller as Barry Allen / The Flash made appearances in the film. In a [[post-credits scene|mid-credits scene]], Waller meets Wayne in a restaurant and hands him a dossier containing information on future members of the [[Justice League]].{{cite web |last=McMillan |first=Graeme |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/suicide-squad-ending-credits-scene-explained-918053 |title=The Comic Book Background Behind 'Suicide Squad's' Mid-Credits Scene |date=August 8, 2016 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} [[File:Patty Jenkins by Gage Skidmore (cropped).jpg|thumb|150px|Patty Jenkins: the director of ''Wonder Woman''; and co-writer and director of ''Wonder Woman 1984'']] === ''Wonder Woman'' (2017) === {{Main|Wonder Woman (2017 film)}} [[Wonder Woman|Diana of Themyscira]], an Amazon warrior who also is the demigoddess daughter of the god [[Zeus (DC Comics)|Zeus]], uses her talents and abilities in order to help humanity during [[World War I]]. Israeli actress and model [[Gal Gadot]] was cast as Diana Prince/Wonder Woman in December 2013 and signed a three-picture deal which included a solo film.{{cite news |last=Kroll |first=Justin |title='Wonder Woman' Gal Gadot Signs Three-Picture Deal with Warner Bros. |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/wonder-woman-gal-gadot-signs-three-picture-deal-with-warner-bros-1201067961/ |work=Variety |accessdate=January 23, 2014 |date=January 23, 2014}} In October 2014, ''Wonder Woman'' was announced by Warner Bros. In November, [[Michelle MacLaren]] was confirmed to direct the film from a screenplay by [[Jason Fuchs]].{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/michelle-maclaren-signs-develop-direct-752055 |title=Michelle MacLaren Signs to Develop and Direct 'Wonder Woman' Movie (Exclusive) |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=November 24, 2014 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}}{{cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/wonder-woman-movie-lassoes-pan-754038 |title='Wonder Woman' Movie Lassoes 'Pan' Writer (Exclusive) |work=The Hollywood Reporter |last=Kit |first=Borys |date=December 4, 2014 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} In April 2015, MacLaren left the project due to creative differences.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/wonder-woman-movie-loses-director-788500 |title='Wonder Woman' Movie Loses Director Michelle MacLaren (Exclusive) |date=April 13, 2015 |accessdate=May 6, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} Later that month, [[Patty Jenkins]] was announced as the new director of the film.{{cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/wonder-woman-finds-a-789099 |title='Wonder Woman' Finds A Director (Exclusive) |work=The Hollywood Reporter |last=Kit |first=Borys |date=April 15, 2015 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} In July, [[Chris Pine]] was cast as [[Steve Trevor]].{{cite web |url=http://thewrap.com/chris-pine-closes-deal-to-star-opposite-gal-gadot-in-wonder-woman-exclusive/ |title=Chris Pine Closes Deal to Star Opposite Gal Gadot in 'Wonder Woman' (Exclusive) |website=[[TheWrap]] |last=Sneider |first=Jeff |date=July 28, 2015 |accessdate=June 2, 2017}} Other cast members include [[Connie Nielsen]] as [[Hippolyta (DC Comics)|Queen Hippolyta]], [[Robin Wright]] as [[Antiope (comics)|General Antiope]], [[Danny Huston]] as [[Erich Ludendorff]], [[Elena Anaya]] as [[Doctor Poison]], and [[David Thewlis]] as [[Ares (DC Comics)|Ares]].{{cite web |last=Romano |first=Nick |url=http://ew.com/movies/2017/05/30/wonder-woman-movie-reviews/ |title=Wonder Woman reviews hail Gal Gadot's 'revelatory,' 'refreshing' performance |date=May 30, 2017 |accessdate=June 6, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}}{{cite web |last=McMillan |first=Graeme |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/wonder-woman-movie-villain-who-is-ares-1009628 |title=A Closer Look at That 'Wonder Woman' Twist |date=June 3, 2017 |accessdate=June 6, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} Filming began in November 2015, and was shot in the [[United Kingdom]], [[France]] and [[Italy]].{{cite web |last=Derschowitz |first=Jessica |url=http://ew.com/article/2015/11/21/wonder-woman-first-photo-cast-details/ |title=Wonder Woman movie: First photo of Gal Gadot, cast details revealed |date=November 21, 2015 |accessdate=May 6, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} ''Wonder Woman'' was released in North America on June 2, 2017.{{cite web |last=Ford |first=Rebecca |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/warner-bros-pushes-jungle-book-881353 |title=Warner Bros. Pushes 'Jungle Book' to 2018, 'Wonder Woman' Gets New Date |date=April 6, 2016 |accessdate=May 6, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} === ''Justice League'' (2017) === {{Main|Justice League (film)}} Motivated by [[Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice|Superman's death]] at the hands of [[Doomsday (comics)|Doomsday]], Batman and Wonder Woman assemble a team of metahumans to face a new catastrophic threat.{{cite web |last=McNary |first=Dave |url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/warner-bros-official-justice-league-plot-logo-1201800699/ |title='Justice League': New Details Emerge About DC's Superhero Movie |work=Variety |date=June 21, 2016 |accessdate=May 9, 2017}} In June 2013, it was reported that Goyer would be writing ''Justice League'' as part of a three-film deal he signed for ''Man of Steel''.{{cite news |last=Finke |first=Nikki |url=http://deadline.com/2013/06/man-of-steel-sequel-underway-with-zack-snyder-and-david-s-goyer-517621/ |title=‘Man Of Steel’ Sequel Underway With Zack Snyder And David S. Goyer |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=June 10, 2013 |accessdate=September 8, 2014}} In April 2014, it was announced that Snyder would return as director.{{cite news |author=Alex Stedman |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/zack-snyder-to-direct-justice-league-movie-1201165409/ |title=Zack Snyder to Direct ‘Justice League’ Movie |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=April 27, 2014 |accessdate=September 8, 2014}} The film was announced in October as ''Justice League Part One''. In March 2016, it was confirmed that Chris Terrio had written the script, who said that the film would not be as tonally dark as ''Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice''.{{cite web |last=Fritz |first=Ben |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2016/03/11/inside-chris-terrios-vision-for-batman-superman-and-justice-league/ |title=Inside Chris Terrio's Vision for Batman, Superman and 'Justice League' |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160311204355/https://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2016/03/11/inside-chris-terrios-vision-for-batman-superman-and-justice-league/ |archivedate=March 11, 2016 |date=March 11, 2016 |accessdate=June 5, 2017 |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]}} In June, Geoff Johns announced that the title had been changed to simply ''Justice League''.{{cite web |last=McMillan |first=Graeme |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/justice-league-movie-gets-title-899835 |title='Justice League' Movie Gets Title Clarified |date=June 6, 2016 |accessdate=June 6, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} Affleck, Cavill, Gadot, Momoa, Miller, Fisher, Irons, Lane, Adams, Eisenberg, Nielsen, Wright, and Morton reprised their respective roles from previous films.{{cite web |last=Romano |first=Nick |url=http://ew.com/movies/2017/03/23/justice-league-poster/ |title=Justice League teaser poster calls to 'unite' the DC heroes |date=March 23, 2017 |accessdate=May 7, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}}{{cite web |last=Woerner |first=Meredith |url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/herocomplex/la-et-hc-wonder-woman-amazons-20170602-htmlstory.html |title=What it's like to be a real-life Amazon on the set of 'Wonder Woman' |quote=Nielsen: And [Wright and I] got to do more in "Justice League" as well. |date=June 2, 2017 |accessdate=June 7, 2017 |work=[[Los Angeles Times]]}}{{cite web |last1=Rougeau |first1=Michael |last2=Elfring |first2=Mat |url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/how-justice-league-will-make-you-care-about-cyborg/1100-6452816/ |title=How Justice League Will Make You Care About Cyborg |date=August 24, 2017 |accessdate=April 4, 2018 |work=[[GameSpot]]}} [[Ciarán Hinds]] provides the voice and [[performance capture]] for the villain [[Steppenwolf (comics)|Steppenwolf]].{{cite news |last=Mottram |first=James |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/bleed-for-this-ciar-n-hinds-excalibur-a7656396.html |title=Ciaran Hinds on Bleed for This, playing a supervillain in Justice League and asking old friend Liam Neeson for motion-capture performance tips |date=March 29, 2017 |accessdate=June 3, 2017 |work=[[The Independent]]}} Beginning on April 11, 2016, filming took place at [[Warner Bros. Studios, Leavesden]], in [[England]], as well as locations around [[London]] and in [[Iceland]].{{cite web |last=Breznican |first=Anthony |url=http://ew.com/article/2016/02/21/justice-league-starts-april-11/ |title=Justice League begins shooting April 11 |date=February 21, 2016 |accessdate=May 6, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} Filming concluded in October 2016.{{cite web |last=Romano |first=Nick |url=http://ew.com/article/2016/10/15/justice-league-ben-affleck-jason-momoa-celebrate-wrap-party/ |title=Justice League: Ben Affleck, Jason Momoa celebrate at wrap party |date=October 15, 2016 |accessdate=June 27, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} In May 2017, Snyder stepped down from his duties on the film due to his daughter's death; [[Joss Whedon]] filled his position on post-production, with additional scenes being written and directed by him.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/zack-snyder-steps-down-justice-league-deal-family-tragedy-1006455 |title=Zack Snyder Steps Down From 'Justice League' to Deal With Family Tragedy |date=May 22, 2017 |accessdate=May 22, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} Though Whedon was not officially credited for his role as post-production director, he completed enough additional work for a screenwriting credit on the film.{{cite web |last1=Stowe |first1=Dusty |title=Justice League: Joss Whedon Officially Getting Co-Writing Credit |url=http://screenrant.com/justice-league-joss-whedon-writing-credit/ |website=[[Screen Rant]] |date=August 29, 2017 |accessdate=September 11, 2017}} ''Justice League'' was released worldwide on November 17, 2017. ''Justice League'' introduced various characters, including [[J. K. Simmons]] as [[James Gordon (comics)|James Gordon]],{{cite news |last1=Ford |first1=Rebecca |title=Justice League' Adds J.K. Simmons as Commissioner Gordon (Exclusive) |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/justice-league-adds-jk-simmons-873227 |accessdate=March 7, 2016 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=March 7, 2016}} [[Amber Heard]] as [[Mera (comics)|Mera]],{{cite web |url=http://etonline.com/movies/184773_amber_heard_confirms_her_aquaman_role_justice_league_dishes_on_interesting_mera_costume/ |title=Exclusive: Amber Heard Confirms Her 'Aquaman' Role in 'Justice League', Dishes on 'Interesting' Mera Costume |work=[[Entertainment Tonight]] |last=Kile |first=Meredith B. |date=March 17, 2016 2017 |accessdate=June 6, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} both [[Kiersey Clemons]] as [[Iris West]] and [[Willem Dafoe]] as [[Nuidis Vulko]] were to be introduced but their scenes were ultimately cut from the film.{{cite web |last=Davidson |first=Matt |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2017/09/23/justice-league-iris-west-scenes-reportedly-cut |title=Justice League: Iris West scenes |accessdate=April 7, 2018 |work=[[GameSpot]]}} [[Joe Manganiello]] as [[Deathstroke|Slade Wilson / Deathstroke]] was also introduced in a post-credits scene, teasing an alliance between him and Lex
