Book Resources]] |date=November 18, 2017 |accessdate=December 16, 2017}} === ''Aquaman'' (2018) === {{Main|Aquaman (film)}} [[File:James Wan at the 2016 San Diego Comic Con (27976781713) (1).jpg|thumb|upright=0.57|James Wan: the co-story writer and director of ''Aquaman'']] Following the events of ''Justice League'', Arthur Curry / Aquaman must fight to retain the [[Atlantis (DC Comics)|Atlantean]] throne from opposing threats. In June 2014, [[Jason Momoa]] was cast as [[Aquaman|Arthur Curry / Aquaman]]. By August, [[Will Beall]] and [[Kurt Johnstad]] were writing competing scripts for the character's solo film.{{cite news |last=Kit |first=Borys |title='Aquaman' Movie Hooks Two Writers (Exclusive) |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/aquaman-movie-hooks-two-writers-724966 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=August 12, 2014 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} ''Aquaman'' was announced in October. In June 2015, [[James Wan]] was hired as director, as well as to oversee the screenplay by Johnstad.{{cite news |last1=Fleming Jr. |first1=Mike |title=James Wan Sets ‘Aquaman’ Deal To Direct Jason Momoa In DC Warners Pic |url=http://deadline.com/2015/06/james-wan-aquaman-jason-momoa-dc-comics-warner-bros-1201437282/ |accessdate=June 3, 2015 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=June 3, 2015}} The film's plot takes place after the events of ''Justice League''.{{cite web |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-great-comic-book-movie-debate-1457637539 |title=The Great Comic-Book Movie Debate |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160312015127/https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-great-comic-book-movie-debate-1457637539 |archivedate=March 12, 2016 |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |last=Fritz |first=Ben |date=March 11, 2016 |accessdate=June 6, 2017}} In November 2015, [[David Leslie Johnson]] was hired to write a new script.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/aquaman-hooks-new-writer-839787 |title=''Aquaman'' Hooks New Writer (Exclusive) |date=November 12, 2015 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=December 21, 2017}} In July 2016, Beall returned to write the script, based on a story treatment by Wan and [[Geoff Johns]].{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |title='Aquaman' Movie Hooks 'Gangster Squad' Writer |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/aquaman-movie-hooks-gangster-squad-913639 |date=July 22, 2016 |accessdate=May 6, 2016 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} In December, [[Patrick Wilson (American actor)|Patrick Wilson]] was cast as [[Ocean Master|Orm / Ocean Master]], the half-brother of Aquaman and the main antagonist of the film.{{cite web |url=https://deadline.com/2016/12/patrick-wilson-aquaman-orm-ocean-master-dc-villain-jason-momoa-1201869055/ |title=Patrick Wilson To Play 'Aquaman's Evil Half-Brother ORM |last=Fleming Jr. |first=Mike |date=December 12, 2016 |accessdate=May 6, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]}}{{cite web |last=Hibberd |first=James |url=http://ew.com/movies/2017/12/14/aquaman-james-wan-villain/?xid=entertainment-weekly_socialflow_twitter |title=James Wan Sinks "Ridiculous" ''Aquaman'' Rumor |date=December 14, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |accessdate=December 14, 2017}} In January 2017, [[Yahya Abdul-Mateen II]] was cast in the role of villain [[Black Manta]].{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/aquaman-finds-black-manta-villain-get-down-actor-970629 |title='Aquaman' Finds Its Black Manta Villain With 'Get Down' Actor (Exclusive) |date=January 31, 2017 |accessdate=May 6, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} In March, [[Nicole Kidman]] confirmed that she will play Queen Atlanna, Aquaman's mother.{{cite web |last=Sperling |first=Nicole |url=http://ew.com/movies/2017/03/31/nicole-kidman-why-she-joined-aquaman/ |title=Nicole Kidman explains why she's diving in for Aquaman |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |date=April 2, 2017 |access-date=April 4, 2017}} In April, [[Dolph Lundgren]] was cast as the villain King Nereus.{{Cite news |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/aquaman-dolph-lundgren-joins-cast-993459 |title=Dolph Lundgren Joins Jason Momoa in 'Aquaman' (Exclusive) |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=April 12, 2017 |accessdate=April 13, 2017}} In June, ''[[Deadline Hollywood]]'' reported that Johnson had returned to the project to work on a rewrite of Beall's script with Wan and producer [[Peter Safran]].{{cite web |last=Busch |first=Anita |url=http://deadline.com/2017/06/the-conjuring-3-movie-new-line-david-leslie-johnson-screenwriter-1202118723/ |title=''The Conjuring 3'' Summoned By New Line Cinema, David Leslie Johnson Hired To Script |date=June 26, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=October 31, 2017}} Heard will reprise her role as Mera from ''Justice League''. Other cast members include [[Willem Dafoe]] as [[Nuidis Vulko]],{{cite web |last=Vejvoda |first=Jim |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2017/08/25/aquaman-willem-dafoe-on-vulkos-costume-and-his-characters-good-look |title=Aquaman: Willem Dafoe on Vulko's costume and his character's "good look" |date=August 25, 2017 |accessdate=April 7, 2018 |website=[[IGN]]}} [[Temuera Morrison]] as Aquaman's father Tom Curry, and [[Ludi Lin]] as Murk, an ally of Aquaman.{{cite web |last=N'Duka |first=Amanda |url=http://deadline.com/2017/05/power-rangers-star-ludi-lin-aquaman-warner-bros-1202094026/ |title='Aquaman': 'Power Rangers' Star Ludi Lin Joins Jason Momoa In DC Comics Pic |date=May 15, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |language=en-US |accessdate=May 16, 2017}} Principal photography began on May 2, 2017, in [[Queensland]], [[Australia]],{{cite web |url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20170503006795/en/ |title=Production is Underway on Warner Bros. Pictures' Super Hero Action Adventure "Aquaman" |date=May 3, 2017 |accessdate=May 3, 2017 |website=[[Business Wire]]}} and wrapped on October 21, 2017.{{cite tweet |user=creepypuppet |last=Wan |first=James |authorlink=James Wan |number=921779011247681536 |title=Holy mackerel, you scampi serious — that’s finally a principal photography WRAP on Aquaman !! Thank You to an awesome cast & crew. |date=October 21, 2017 |accessdate=October 21, 2017}} ''Aquaman'' is scheduled to be released in North America on December 21, 2018.{{cite web |last1=Hipes |first1=Patrick |title='Aquaman' Swims To Christmas 2018 Date Where 'Avatar 2' Was |url=http://deadline.com/2017/03/aquaman-release-date-christmas-2018-avatar-2-move-1202044988/ |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=March 16, 2017 |accessdate=March 16, 2017}} == Additional materials == [[File:BvS Communion Scene Steppenwolf.png|thumb|right|The "Communion" scene in ''Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice'' teases the events in ''Justice League'', showing the villain [[Steppenwolf (comics)|Steppenwolf]] and the three [[Mother Box]]es.]] In order to expand and build the universe the films are set in, some additional material has been released, such as additional scenes or bonus material included in the home releases of the films. The purpose of said material is also to set up and tease the overarching narrative that future installments of the franchise will adhere to. In the case of additional scenes, on March 28, 2016, Warner Bros. released to the public via its YouTube channel, a scene not shown in theaters from ''Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice'', titled "Communion", which teased the events that would be depicted in ''Justice League''; the scene was later integrated in the Ultimate Edition home release of the film. Similarly, in the Blu-ray disc home release of ''Wonder Woman'', an epilogue is included in the form of a [[short film|short]] titled "Etta's Mission", which details a final incident that transpired after the events of the film. Etta teases the existence of a Mother Box, which is crucial to the storyline of ''Justice League''.{{cite news |author=Brian Jacks |url=https://www.cinemablend.com/news/1697329/how-the-new-wonder-woman-epilogue-will-connect-to-justice-league |title=How The New Wonder Woman Epilogue Will Connect To Justice League |website=Cinemablend.com |accessdate=March 1, 2018}} Also, in the Blu-ray home release of ''Justice League'', two additional scenes not shown in the theatrical cut are included, which further flesh-out the return of Superman and him joining the League. Furthermore, the various special featurettes and documentaries included in the Blu-ray home releases of the films feature concept arts and designs, as well as background information that greatly expands the shared universe; giving detailed insight into the fictional history, technology, worlds and cultures that appear in the films. Although not all the films in the franchise resort to this practice, some of them make use of [[post-credits scene]]s to further develop character relationships and establish the plot elements that will influence future installments, such as ''Suicide Squad'' and ''Justice League''. == Future == {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center; width:99%;" |- ! scope="column" style="width:20%"| Film ! scope="col" | U.S. release date ! scope="col" style="width:14%;" | Director(s) ! scope="col" | Screenwriter(s) ! scope="col" | Story by ! scope="col" | Producer(s) ! scope="col" | Status |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[Shazam! (film)|Shazam!]]'' | style="text-align:center" | {{Start date|2019|4|5}} | [[David F. Sandberg]] | Henry Gayden | Henry Gayden and [[Darren Lemke]] | Peter Safran | Post-production |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[#Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of one Harley Quinn) (2020)|Birds of Prey
{{small|(and the Fantabulous Emancipation
of one Harley Quinn)}}]]'' | {{Start date|2020|2|7}} | [[Cathy Yan]] | colspan="2" | [[Christina Hodson]] | [[Margot Robbie]], Sue Kroll and Bryan Unkeless | Pre-production |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[Wonder Woman 1984]]'' | style="text-align:center" | {{Start date|2020|06|05}} | Patty Jenkins | Patty Jenkins & Geoff Johns and [[David Callaham]] | Patty Jenkins & Geoff Johns | Charles Roven, Deborah Snyder, Zack Snyder, Patty Jenkins, Stephen Jones and [[Gal Gadot]] | Filming |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[#The Flash (2020)|The Flash]]'' | {{N/A|TBA}} | [[Jonathan Goldstein (filmmaker)|Jonathan Goldstein]] and [[John Francis Daley]] | [[Seth Grahame-Smith]] and [[Chris Brancato]] and [[Joby Harold]] and [[Dan Mazeau]] | Seth Grahame-Smith and [[Rick Famuyiwa]] and [[Phil Lord and Christopher Miller|Phil Lord & Christopher Miller]] and [[Greg Berlanti]] & [[Michael Green (writer)|Michael Green]] & Chris Brancato & [[Marc Guggenheim]] | Geoff Johns, Richard Suckle, Jon Berg, Zack Snyder, Alex Gartner, [[Dan Mazer]], Deborah Snyder, [[Denise Di Novi]], Phil Lord and Christopher Miller | rowspan="2" | In development |- ! scope="row" style="text-align:left" | ''[[#The Batman (TBA)|The Batman]]'' | {{N/A|TBA}} | colspan="3" | [[Matt Reeves]] | [[Ben Affleck]], Geoff Johns and Matt Reeves |- |} [[File:David F. Sandberg by Gage Skidmore 2.jpg|thumb|upright=0.63|left|David F. Sandberg: the director of ''Shazam!'']] === ''Shazam!'' (2019) === {{Main|Shazam! (film)}} By shouting "Shazam", a 14-year-old foster child, [[Billy Batson]], can turn into an adult superhero, courtesy of an ancient wizard. He attempts to master his powers and defeat the evil forces controlled by [[Doctor Sivana]].{{cite web |last=Auty |first=Dan |url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dcs-shazam-plot-revealed-in-new-synopsis/1100-6456593/ |title=DC's Shazam: Plot Revealed In New Synopsis |date=February 7, 2018 |accessdate=March 28, 2018 |work=[[GameSpot]]}} In August 2014, [[Dwayne Johnson]] announced his attachment to a project about the superhero [[Captain Marvel (DC Comics)|Shazam]], formerly known as Captain Marvel.{{cite news |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/dwayne-johnson-shazam-1201286278/ |title=Dwayne Johnson Says He'll Play Role in 'Shazam' |work=Variety |date=August 19, 2014 |accessdate=December 4, 2014 |last=McNary |first=Dave}} In September, Johnson was revealed to be portraying the antihero [[Black Adam]], Shazam's nemesis in the film, with Darren Lemke set to write the script.{{cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/dwayne-johnson-to-play-black-adam-in-shazam-darren-lemke-to-script-exclusive-1201294338/ |title=Dwayne Johnson to Play Black Adam in New Line’s 'Shazam,' Darren Lemke To Script (Exclusive) |date=September 3, 2014 |accessdate=May 5, 2017 |work=Variety}} In October, Warner Bros. announced ''Shazam'' as a film in its upcoming slate. By January 2017, Henry Gayden was working on the script.{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/dwayne-johnsons-dc-villain-black-adam-getting-his-own-movie-966008 |title=Dwayne Johnson's DC Villain Black Adam Getting His Own Movie |author=Kit, Borys |date=January 19, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=March 18, 2017}} In July, [[David F. Sandberg]] was confirmed as director of the film.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/shazam-is-next-dc-movie-shoot-1022821 |title='Shazam!' Is Next DC Movie to Shoot (Exclusive) |date=July 20, 2017 |accessdate=July 20, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} It was also confirmed that month that, despite the initial announcement, Dwayne Johnson would not appear as Black Adam in ''Shazam!'', but will instead star in a solo film.{{cite web |last=Errico |first=Marcus |url=https://www.yahoo.com/movies/dwayne-johnson-wont-dcs-shazam-movie-151617830.html |title=Dwayne Johnson Won't Be in DC's 'Shazam!' Movie |date=July 21, 2017 |accessdate=July 21, 2017 |publisher=[[Yahoo!]]}} Pre-production began with the casting process for Shazam's child-age alter ego Billy Batson in August.{{cite web |url=http://screenrant.com/shazam-movie-casting-filming/ |title=Shazam! Officially Begins Pre-Production |date=August 29, 2017 |website=[[Screen Rant]]}} By October, [[Zachary Levi]] was cast as Shazam. In November, [[Grace Fulton]] joined the cast as Shazam's foster sister, [[Mary Marvel|Mary Bromfield]].{{cite web |author=Michael Vassallo |url=https://heroichollywood.com/shazam-grace-fulton-mary-marvel/ |title=DC Comic's 'Shazam!' Director Confirms Grace Fulton Is Mary Marvel |website=Heroichollywood.com |date=September 1, 2017 |accessdate=December 16, 2017}} Fulton is reteaming with the director after ''[[Annabelle: Creation]]''.{{cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/grace-fulton-shazam-annabelle-creation-1202605521/ |title=''Annabelle Creation'' Actress Grace Fulton Joins ''Shazam'' |date=November 2, 2017 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=November 2, 2017}} The film's primary villain will be Doctor Sivana, with actor [[Mark Strong]] cast in the role.{{cite web |last=Gonzalez |first=Umberto |url=https://www.thewrap.com/mark-strong-doctor-sivana-shazam/ |title=Mark Strong In Talks To Play Doctor Sivana In DC's ''Shazam'' |date=November 2, 2017 |work=[[TheWrap]] |accessdate=November 2, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.contactmusic.net/mark-strong/news/mark-strong-spills-on-shazam-secrecy_5955962 |title=Mark Strong spills on Shazam! secrecy |date=January 14, 2018 |website=[[Contactmusic.com]] |language=en-US |access-date=January 15, 2018}} Later that month, [[Asher Angel]] was cast as Billy Batson.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/shazam-asher-angel-star-as-billy-batson-dc-movie-1055189 |title='Shazam!' Finds Its Billy Batson with 'Andi Mack' Actor |date=November 6, 2017 |accessdate=April 4, 2018 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} In December, [[Jack Dylan Grazer]] was cast as [[Captain Marvel Jr.|Frederick "Freddy" Freeman]], Batson's foster brother and best friend. Later that month, Jovan Armand, [[Ian Chen (actor)|Ian Chen]], and Faithe Herman were cast as Batson's foster siblings [[Marvel Family#Pedro|Pedro Peña]], [[Marvel Family#Eugene|Eugene Choi]], and [[Marvel Family#Darla|Darla Dudley]] respectively,{{cite web |last=N'Duka |first=Amanda |url=http://deadline.com/2017/12/it-jack-dylan-grazer-shazam-dc-movie-1202221613/ |title=''It'' Actor Jack Dylan Grazer Joins ''Shazam'' |date=December 6, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=December 6, 2017}}{{cite web |last=N'Duka |first=Amanda |url=http://deadline.com/2017/12/ian-chen-jovan-armand-shazam-brian-astro-bradley-jr-luce-1202225185/ |title=Ian Chen & Jovan Armand Join ''Shazam'' |date=December 12, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=December 12, 2017}}{{cite web |last=Outlaw |first=Kofi |url=http://comicbook.com/dc/2017/12/21/dc-shazam-movie-faithe-herman-darla-dudley/ |title="DC's 'Shazam' Adds 'This Is Us' Actress Faithe Herman to Cast" |date=December 21, 2017 |website=Comicbook.com |accessdate=December 21, 2017}} while [[Cooper Andrews]] and Marta Milans will portray Billy's foster parents.{{cite web |last=N'Duka |first=Amanda |url=http://deadline.com/2017/12/the-walking-deads-cooper-andrews-shazam-new-line-1202229944/ |title=''The Walking Dead's'' Cooper Andrews Joins ''Shazam'' |date=December 19, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=December 19, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2018/01/shazam-marta-milans-zachary-levi-new-line-comic-book-superhero-film-1202266511/ |title='Shazam!': Marta Milans Joins Zachary Levi In New Line Superhero Pic |last=Ramos |first=Dino-Ray |date=January 22, 2018 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=January 22, 2018}} By January 2018, [[Ron Cephas Jones]] was in negotiations to portray the wizard, [[Shazam (wizard)|Shazam]], who gives Billy his powers,{{cite web |last=Gonzalez |first=Umberto |url=https://www.thewrap.com/ron-cephas-jones-wizard-dc-superhero-shazam/ |title=‘This Is Us’ Star Ron Cephas Jones Circles Wizard Role in DC Superhero Film ‘SHAZAM!’ (Exclusive) |date=January 18, 2018 |accessdate=March 28, 2018 |work=[[TheWrap]]}} but was replaced by [[Djimon Hounsou]] due to scheduling conflicts.{{cite web |last=Hibberd |first=James |url=http://ew.com/movies/2018/07/10/djimon-hounsou-shazam-wizard/ |title=DC's Shazam! casts Guardians actor Djimon Hounsou as the Wizard |date=July 10, 2018 |publisher=''Entertainment Weekly'' |accessdate=July 10, 2018}} The film began principal photography in [[Toronto]] on January 29, 2018, and wrapped on May 11, 2018,{{cite web |last=Sandberg |first=David F. |authorlink=David F. Sandberg |title=David F. Sandberg on Instagram: "Let’s go!⚡️" |url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BeipkbDAYpp/ |website=[[Instagram]] |date=January 29, 2018 |accessdate=January 29, 2018}}{{cite web |last=Drum |first=Nicole |url=http://comicbook.com/dc/2017/09/18/shazam-filming-toronto-february/ |title='Shazam!' to Start Filming Next Spring |date=September 18, 2017 |accessdate=March 29, 2018 |website=Comicbook.com}}{{cite tweet |user=ponysmasher |last=Sandberg |first=David F. |number=9995017103894695936 |title=That’s a wrap on Shazam! Now onto months of post production. |date=May 11, 2018 |accessdate=May 11, 2018}} with most of the filming taking place at [[Pinewood Toronto Studios]], among other locations around the city.{{cite web |last1=Vlessing |first1=Etan |title=Pinewood Toronto to Double Production Space as Hollywood Takes City to Full Capacity |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/pinewood-toronto-double-production-space-as-hollywood-takes-city-full-capacity-1066693 |website=The Hollywood Reporter |date=December 12, 2017 |accessdate=December 16, 2017}} ''Shazam!'' will be released in North America on April 5, 2019.{{cite web |last=Couto |first=Anthony |url=http://www.cbr.com/shazam-release-date-confirmed-2019// |title=Shazam! Director Confirms April 2019 Release Date |date=October 21, 2017 |website=[[Comic Book Resources]] |accessdate=October 21, 2017}} ==={{anchor|Birds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of one Harley Quinn) (2020)}}''Birds of Prey'' (2020)=== By November 2016, ''Birds of Prey'', based on the female superhero team [[Birds of Prey (comics)|of the same name]], was in development with [[Christina Hodson]] signed on as screenwriter.{{cite web |url=https://www.thewrap.com/harley-quinn-birds-of-prey-christina-hodson/ |title=Harley Quinn-Birds of Prey Movie's Screenwriter Revealed (Exclusive) |last=Gonzalez |first=Umberto |date=November 11, 2016 |work=[[TheWrap]] |accessdate=December 16, 2017}} By April 2018, Warner Bros. selected [[Cathy Yan]] as director, with Margot Robbie, Sue Kroll, and Bryan Unkless serving as producers for the project. Robbie will reprise her role as Harleen Quinzel / Harley Quinn from ''Suicide Squad''. The film is expected to be the first theatrical R-rated installment in the franchise and will have a smaller budget than most of the other films.{{cite web |url=https://www.flickeringmyth.com/2018/07/exclusive-margot-robbie-confirms-january-production-start-for-birds-of-prey/ |title=Exclusive: Margot Robbie confirms January production start for ''Birds of Prey'', will have “much smaller budget” than other DC movies |last=Cooper |first=Freda |date=July 6, 2018 |work=FlickeringMyth |accessdate=August 9, 2018}} In addition to Robbie's starring role, the team roster will also include [[Mary Elizabeth Winstead]], [[Jurnee Smollett-Bell]], [[Rosie Perez]], and Ella Jay Basco as [[Huntress (Helena Bertinelli)|Huntress]], [[Black Canary|Black Canary]], [[Renee Montoya|Renee Montoya]], and [[Cassandra Cain]], respectively.{{cite web |url=https://www.thewrap.com/birds-of-prey-rosie-perez-renee-montoya/ |title=‘Birds of Prey': Rosie Perez Cast as Renee Montoya in Superheroine Movie (Exclusive) |last=Gonzalez |first=Umberto |date=October 3, 2018 |website=TheWrap |access-date=October 4, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://deadline.com/2018/09/birds-of-prey-cast-mary-elizabeth-winstead-wins-role-of-huntress-jurnee-smollett-bell-is-black-canary-1202471751/ |title='Birds Of Prey' Cast: Mary Elizabeth Winstead Wins Role Of Huntress; Jurnee Smollett-Bell Is Black Canary |last=D'Alessandro |first=Anthony |date=September 26, 2018 |website=Deadline Hollywood |access-date=October 4, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.thewrap.com/birds-of-prey-black-canary-huntress-cassandra-cain-renee-montoya/ |title=''Birds of Prey'' Revealed: Margot Robbie Film Will Feature Black Canary, Huntress, Cassandra Cain, Renee Montoya (Exclusive) |last=Gonzalez |first=Umberto |date=July 16, 2018 |work=TheWrap |accessdate=August 9, 2018}} [[Black Mask (comics)|Black Mask]] will serve as the film's primary antagonist with [[Ewan McGregor]] portraying the character.{{cite web |url=https://www.thewrap.com/birds-of-prey-villain-black-mask-batman/ |title=''Birds of Prey'' Villain Revealed as Black Mask, One of Batman’s Deadliest Foes (Exclusive) |last=Gonzalez |first=Umberto |date=August 6, 2018 |work=TheWrap |accessdate=August 9, 2018}}{{cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2018/11/ewan-mcgregor-joins-birds-of-prey-as-villain-black-mask-1202494174/|title=Ewan McGregor Joins ‘Birds Of Prey’ As Villain Black Mask|first=Anthony|last=D'Alessandro|date=November 1, 2018|website=Deadline.com|accessdate=November 1, 2018}} The film began pre-production in late July 2018,{{cite web |url=https://deadline.com/2018/07/margot-robbie-gary-oldman-ben-affleck-movies-california-film-tax-credits-1202431629/ |title=Gary Oldman’s ‘Flying Horse,’ Margot Robbie’s ‘Birds Of Prey’ & Ben Affleck’s ‘Has-Been’ Among 19 Films Snaring California Tax Incentives |last=Patten |first=Dominic |date=July 23, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=August 9, 2018}} with principal photography scheduled to commence on January 15, 2019 in [[Los Angeles]] under the [[working title]] ''Fox Force Five''.{{cite web |url=https://deadline.com/2018/04/harley-quinn-margot-robbie-cathy-yan-birds-of-prey-warner-bros-dc-entertainment-bat-girl-christina-hodson-1202365866/ |title=Cathy Yan Is Warner Bros' Choice To Direct Margot Robbie In Next Harley Quinn Film |last=Fleming Jr |first=Mike |date=April 17, 2018 |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=April 17, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://heroichollywood.com/birds-prey-dc-films-start-date/ |title=DC Films’ ‘Birds Of Prey’ Eyes 2019 Start Date; All-Female Crew (Exclusive) |last=Brail |first=Nate |date=May 14, 2018 |publisher=HeroicHollywood |accessdate=May 14, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://thegww.com/update-birds-of-prey-start-date-set-for-mid-january-in-los-angeles/ |title=UPDATE: ''BIRDS OF PREY'' START DATE SET FOR MID-JANUARY IN LOS ANGELES |last=Marc |first=Christopher |date=July 18, 2018 |work=TheGWW |accessdate=July 20, 2018}} In November 2018, Robbie revealed the full title of the film as, ''Birds of Prey (And the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn)''.{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/amp/heat-vision/birds-prey-is-called-fantabulous-emancipation-one-harley-quinn-1163151|title=Margot Robbie Reveals Full 'Birds of Prey' Title: 'The Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn'|website=thehollywoodreporter|date=November 20, 2018}} Warner Bros. had the slated film scheduled to be released on February 14, 2020, but ''Birds of Prey'' moved the date forward one week, to February 7, 2020.{{cite web |last1=Couch |first1=Aaron |title=Margot Robbie's 'Birds of Prey' Gets 2020 Release Date |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/birds-prey-movie-open-2020-1146570 |website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=September 24, 2018 |date=September 24, 2018}} === ''Wonder Woman 1984'' (2020) === {{Main|Wonder Woman 1984}} By June 2017, Geoff Johns and Patty Jenkins had begun work on the story treatment for a ''Wonder Woman'' sequel.{{cite web |last=Nyren |first=Erin |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/wonder-woman-sequel-patty-jenkins-1202472855/ |title=Patty Jenkins Developing 'Wonder Woman' Sequel (Exclusive) |date=June 20, 2017 |accessdate=June 20, 2017 |work=Variety}} By July, Johns announced that he is working on the script for the film.{{cite web |last=Errico |first=Marcus |url=https://www.yahoo.com/movies/wonder-woman-2-script-worked-right-now-225249507.html |title='Wonder Woman 2' Script Being 'Worked On Right Now' |date=July 21, 2017 |accessdate=July 22, 2017 |publisher=[[Yahoo!]]}} That same month, the sequel was officially announced at San Diego Comic-Con. Gadot will reprise her role as Wonder Woman. By September, Jenkins signed a deal to return as director,{{cite web |last1=Kroll |first1=Justin |title=Patty Jenkins Closes Deal to Direct 'Wonder Woman' Sequel (Exclusive) |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/patty-jenkins-wonder-woman-sequel-director-1202548413/ |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=September 11, 2017 |accessdate=September 11, 2017}} and brought on [[David Callaham]] to pen the script with her and Johns. The film takes place in the 1980s during the [[Cold War]].{{cite web |last1=Gonzalez |first1=Umberto |last2=Molloy |first2=Tim |url=https://www.thewrap.com/justice-league-zack-snyder-batman-v-superman-wonder-woman/ |title=How ''Justice League'' Became A ''Frankenstein'' |date=November 29, 2017 |accessdate=November 29, 2017 |work=[[TheWrap]]}}{{cite web |url=https://screenrant.com/wonder-woman-2-setting-patty-jenkins/ |title=Patty Jenkins Confirms Wonder Woman 2 Is Set In The '80s |last=Stauffer |first=Derek |date=April 24, 2018 |publisher=ScreenRant |accessdate=April 24, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/wonder-woman-2-geoff-johns-teases-ww84-1116448 |title='Wonder Woman 2' Setting Teased by Patty Jenkins and DC's Geoff Johns |last=Couch |first=Aaron |date=June 1, 2018 |website=The Hollywood Reporter |access-date=October 4, 2018}} Jenkins said the film, like its predecessor, will be a love story, but with a new love interest.{{cite web |last=Daly |first=Rhian |url=http://www.nme.com/news/film/director-patty-jenkins-teases-details-wonder-woman-2-storyline-2167289/ |date=December 1, 2017 |accessdate=December 1, 2017 |title=Director Patty Jenkins teases more details of "Wonder Woman 2" storyline |website=[[NME]]}} Pre-production had begun by early December 2017, with filming scheduled to start in June 2018, under the working title ''Magic Hour''.{{cite web |last=Nambiar |first=Smitha |url=http://pursuenews.com/director-patty-jenkins-confirms-wonder-woman-2-pre-production/ |date=December 6, 2017 |access-date=December 6, 2017 |title=Director Patty Jenkins Confirms 'Wonder Woman 2' Is In Pre-Production |website=PursueNews.com}}{{cite web |url=http://comicbook.com/dc/2018/02/08/wonder-woman-2-working-title-magic-hour/ |title='Wonder Woman 2' Working Title Revealed |last=Mueller |first=Matthew |date=February 8, 2018 |website=Comicbook.com |accessdate=February 8, 2018}} By March 2018, [[Kristen Wiig]] was cast to portray the film's primary antagonist, [[Cheetah (comics)#Barbara Ann Minerva|Barbara Ann Minerva / Cheetah]].{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2018/02/kristen-wiig-wonder-woman-2-cheetah-gal-gadot-patty-jenkins-villain2-1202306419/ |title=Kristen Wiig Being Lassoed For Villain Role On 'Wonder Woman 2' |first=Mike |last=Fleming Jr |date=February 28, 2018 |accessdate=March 13, 2018 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]}}{{cite web |last=Clark |first=Travis |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/wonder-woman-director-patty-jenkins-confirms-kristen-wiig-as-cheetah-2018-3 |title='Wonder Woman' director Patty Jenkins confirms Kristen Wiig will play the villain Cheetah in the sequel |date=March 9, 2018 |accessdate=March 29, 2018 |work=[[Business Insider]]}} That same month, [[Pedro Pascal]] was also cast in a key role.{{cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/pedro-pascal-wonder-woman-sequel-narcos-1202738657/ |title='Narcos' Star Pedro Pascal Lands Key Role in 'Wonder Woman' Sequel (Exclusive) |date=March 29, 2018 |accessdate=March 30, 2018 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]}} Production began on June 13, 2018 around the [[District of Columbia]] and [[Northern Virginia]].{{cite web |url=https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20180613005640/en/Cameras-Roll-Warner-Bros.-Pictures%E2%80%99-%E2%80%9CWonder-Woman |title=Cameras Roll on Warner Bros. Pictures' 'Wonder Woman 1984' |work=Business Wire |date=June 13, 2018 |accessdate=June 13, 2018}} Other filming locations include the [[Warner Bros. Studios, Leavesden]] in the [[United Kingdom]] and the islands of [[Tenerife]] and [[Fuerteventura]] in [[Spain]].{{cite web |last=Ritman |first=Alex |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/5-london-studios-hollywood-loves-1084530/item/5-london-studios-hollywood-loves-pinewood-studios-1084533 |title=5 London Studios Hollywood Loves |date=February 19, 2018 |accessdate=February 27, 2018 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}}{{cite web |url=https://heroichollywood.com/wonder-woman-2-shooting-stateside-summer/ |title=‘Wonder Woman 2’ Reportedly Shooting Stateside This Summer |last=Villaverde |first=Noah |date=March 18, 2018 |website=Heroichollywood.com |accessdate=March 18, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.guidetocanaryislands.com/tenerife-will-be-one-of-the-filming-locations-for-the-next-wonder-woman-movie/ |title=Tenerife will be one of the filming locations for the next Wonder Woman movie |date=April 20, 2018 |accessdate=May 14, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.canarias7.es/siete-islas/fuerteventura/el-rodaje-de-wonder-woman-desembarca-a-finales-del-verano-MH4584385 |title=El rodaje de 'Wonder Woman' desembarca a finales del verano |last=Monserrat |first=David |date=May 19, 2018 |publisher=Canarias7 (in Spanish) |accessdate=May 29, 2018}} ''Wonder Woman 1984'' is scheduled to be released in North America on June 5, 2020.{{cite news|first1=Anthony|last1=D'Alessandro|accessdate=2018-10-22|title=‘Wonder Woman 1984’ Flies To Summer 2020|url=https://deadline.com/2018/10/wonder-woman-1984-flies-to-summer-2020-1202487260/|newspaper=Deadline|date=October 22, 2018}} === ''The Flash'' (TBA) === {{further|Flash in other media#The Flash (2020)}} By July 2013, [[Greg Berlanti]] was developing a film that centered around [[Flash (Barry Allen)|Barry Allen / The Flash]].{{cite news |last=Goldberg |first=Lesley |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/flash-series-arrow-producers-works-595486 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |title='Flash' Series From 'Arrow' Producers in the Works at CW |date=July 30, 2013 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} In October 2014, ''The Flash'' was announced with a scheduled 2018 release date. The initial script was drafted by Berlanti, [[Chris Brancato]], [[Michael Green (writer)|Michael Green]] and [[Marc Guggenheim]].{{cite web |url=http://herocomplex.latimes.com/tv/flash-may-get-his-own-show-on-cw-arrow-will-introduce-dc-hero/ |title=''Flash'' May Get His Own Show On CW; ''Arrow'' Will Introduce DC Hero |date=July 30, 2018 |work=LATimes |accessdate=August 20, 2018}} In April 2015, a story treatment was written by [[Phil Lord and Christopher Miller]] based on the previous draft, with the intent being that the duo would also direct the film.{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2015/04/the-flash-superhero-movie-lord-miller-warner-bros-1201407459/ |title='The Flash' Movie: 'Lego' Guys Phil Lord & Christopher Miller Building Warner Bros Pic |work=Deadline Hollywood |last=Busch |first=Anita |date=April 9, 2015 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} Over the next two years, [[Seth Grahame-Smith]] and [[Rick Famuyiwa]], had individually dropped out of the project due to creative differences with the studio.{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/flash-movie-loses-director-888994 |title='The Flash' Movie Loses Its Director (Exclusive) |work=The Hollywood Reporter |last=Kit |first=Borys |date=April 29, 2016 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}}{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |title='The Flash' Movie Loses 'Dope' Director Rick Famuyiwa (Exclusive) |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/flash-movie-loses-dope-director-rick-famuyiwa-942604 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=October 31, 2016 |accessdate=October 31, 2016}} In January 2017, [[Joby Harold]] was hired to do a page-one rewrite of the script, which previously had drafts written by Grahame-Smith and Famuyiwa.{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/joby-harold-the-flash-script-rewrite-1201969977/ |title=Joby Harold to Do Page-One Rewrite of 'The Flash' Script (Exclusive) |work=Variety |last=Kroll |first=Justin |date=January 25, 2017 |accessdate=May 6, 2017}} In July 2017, the title for the film was changed to ''Flashpoint'',{{cite web |last=Truitt |first=Brian |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/movies/2017/07/22/comic-con-ben-affleck-batman-dc/502287001/ |title=Comic-Con: Ben Affleck confirms he's staying on as Batman in DC films |date=July 22, 2017 |accessdate=July 22, 2017 |work=[[USA Today]]}} based on the comic book story arc [[Flashpoint (comics)|of the same name]].{{cite web |last=McMillan |first=Graeme |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/flash-flashpoint-movie-could-be-key-dc-universe-comic-con-1023606 |title=New 'Flash' Movie Title Suggests It Could Shake Up the DC Universe |date=July 22, 2017 |accessdate=July 22, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} In March 2018, [[John Francis Daley]] and [[Jonathan Goldstein (screenwriter)|Jonathan Goldstein]] were hired to direct.{{cite web |last=Muncy |first=Julie |url=https://io9.gizmodo.com/flashpoint-has-closed-the-deal-on-two-directors-1823498395 |title=Flashpoint Has Closed the Deal on Two Directors |date=March 4, 2018 |accessdate=March 29, 2018 |website=[[io9]]}}{{cite web |last=Schaefer |first=Sandy |url=https://screenrant.com/flashpoint-batgirl-dc-films-wonder-woman-2/ |title=Flashpoint & Batgirl Movies Look to Follow Wonder Woman 2 |date=February 20, 2018 |website=[[Screen Rant]] |accessdate=March 13, 2018}} Zack Snyder, Alex Gartner, Geoff Johns, [[Dan Mazer]], [[Richard Suckle]], Deborah Snyder, Phil Lord, Chris Miller, Jon Berg, and [[Denise Di Novi]] will serve as producers on the project. [[Dan Mazeau]] was brought on as co-writer,{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/flash-movie-writer-dan-mazeau-tackling-ernie-clines-armada-1099132 |title='Flash' Movie Writer Dan Mazeau Tackling Ernie Cline's 'Armada' |date=April 3, 2018 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=April 3, 2018}} followed by Grahame-Smith and Brancato as additional screenwriters.{{cite web |last=Prasad |first=R.A |url=https://pursuenews.com/the-flash-movie-seth-grahame-smith-gets-a-writer-credit-logan-writer-onboard/ |title=''The Flash'' Movie: Seth Grahame-Smith Gets A Writer Credit, ''Logan'' Writer Onboard |date=August 9, 2018 |work=PursueNews |accessdate=August 10, 2018}} Daley and Goldstein had initially announced the release of ''The Flash'' to be sometime during 2020,{{cite web |last=Daley |first=John |url=https://twitter.com/johnfdaley/status/1010634780172603394?lang=en |title=If all goes well, sometime in 2020 |date=June 23, 2018 |publisher=''Twitter'' |accessdate=August 10, 2018}} though production was delayed from April 2019 to later in the same year to allow for additional work on the script. Principal photography will take place in [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]], and follow in [[Leavesden, Hertfordshire|Leavesden, Hertfordshire, England]].https://variety.com/2018/film/news/flash-standalone-movie-release-date-1202980356/ The tone of the film will be similar to ''[[Back to the Future]]''.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/DiscussingFilm/status/1030570557941710853|title=DiscussingFilm on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}}{{cite web |last=Prasad |first=R.A |url=https://pursuenews.com/the-flash-movie-reportedly-begins-filming-next-year-in-february-location-revealed/ |title=The Flash Movie Reportedly Begins Filming Next Year In February, Location Revealed |date=August 3, 2018 |work=PursueNews |accessdate=August 4, 2018}}{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/amp/heat-vision/joker-batman-suicide-squad-movie-plans-making-sense-dcs-moves-1119489 |title=Warner Bros. Shifts DC Strategy Amid Executive Change-Up |date=June 13, 2018 |publisher=''The Hollywood Reporter'' |accessdate=June 13, 2018}}{{cite web |last=Marc |first=Christopher |url=https://thegww.com/wbs-flash-movie-is-expected-to-wrap-filming-by-next-may/ |title=WB’S ''FLASH'' IS EXPECTED TO WRAP FILMING BY NEXT MAY |date=August 20, 2018 |work=OmegaUnderground |accessdate=August 20, 2018}} === ''The Batman'' (TBA) === [[File:Matt Reeves by Gage Skidmore.jpg|thumb|upright=0.65|Matt Reeves: the screenwriter, co-story writer, director and co-producer of ''The Batman'']] In October 2014, a Batman standalone film was announced by Warner Bros. By 2016, Ben Affleck was set to star in, produce, direct, and write the project. [[Geoff Johns]] was hired as co-writer.{{cite news |url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/ben-affleck-solo-batman-movie-1201537304/ |title='Batman': Ben Affleck in Talks to Star in, Co-Write, Possibly Direct Standalone Movie |last1=Kroll |first1=Justin |date=July 9, 2015 |work=Variety |accessdate=July 13, 2015}}{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/ben-affleck-has-written-his-879355 |title=Ben Affleck Has Written His Own 'Batman' Script |last=McMillan |first=Graeme |date=March 30, 2016 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=March 30, 2016}}{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/ben-affleck-batman-standalone-directing-1201752021/ |title=Ben Affleck Confirmed to Direct Standalone Batman Movie |last=Stedman |first=Alex |date=April 12, 2016 |work=Variety |accessdate=May 27, 2017}} The film was on track to begin shooting in 2017,{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/ben-affleck-batman-live-by-night-1201941876/ |title=Ben Affleck Says 'The Batman' On Track to Shoot in Spring: 'Everything Is Coming Together' |last=Lang |first=Brent |date=December 14, 2016 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=December 14, 2016}} until Affleck stepped down as director in January 2017, in order to more efficiently focus on starring as the eponymous role.{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/ben-affleck-the-batman-will-not-direct-1201971566/ |title=Ben Affleck Will Not Direct 'The Batman' (Exclusive) |last1=Justin |first1=Kroll |date=January 30, 2017 |website=Variety |accessdate=January 31, 2017}} In February 2017, Warner Bros. announced the title as ''The Batman'' and revealed that [[Matt Reeves]] would direct and co-produce the film.{{cite news |url=http://deadline.com/2017/02/matt-reeves-is-new-batman-director-1201957224/ |title=As You Read Here, Matt Reeves Is New 'Batman' Director |last=Fleming Jr. |first=Mike |date=February 23, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=February 23, 2017}} By July of that year, Reeves confirmed that the script was being rewritten.{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/batman-director-matt-reeves-has-dropped-ben-afflecks-script-1020694 |title='Batman' Director Matt Reeves Has Dropped Ben Affleck's Script |last=Shanley |first=Patrick |date=July 12, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=July 12, 2017}} The story has reportedly been reworked to focus on Batman earlier on in his career as a vigilante.{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/joker-batman-suicide-squad-movie-plans-making-sense-dcs-moves-1119489|title=Warner Bros. Shifts DC Strategy Amid Executive Change-Up|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} The film will be character-driven and stylistically [[Film noir|noir]], and will explore Batman's experiences as the world's greatest detective. Reeves stated that the film will feature this aspect of the character to a greater extent than previous Batman films.{{cite web |url=https://www.slashfilm.com/the-batman-update/ |title=Matt Reeves Expects a Draft of ''The Batman'' in Two Weeks, Will Be a “Noir-Driven Definitive Batman Story” [TCA 2018] |last=Topel |first=Fred |date=August 2, 2018 |work=SlashFilm |accessdate=August 9, 2018}} In August 2018, Reeves announced that the script is near its final draft, and that principal photography is planned to begin early 2019.{{cite web |last=Agar |first=Chris |url=https://screenrant.com/ben-affleck-batman-movie-producer-filming/ |title=Ben Affleck Still Producing ''The Batman''; Filming Starts Spring 2019 |date=August 9, 2018 |work=ScreenRant |accessdate=August 25, 2018}} Affleck remains attached to the project and will serve as producer alongside Johns.{{cite web |url=https://www.cbr.com/batman-finlming-spring-2019-ben-affleck-producer/ |title=The Batman to Begin Filming in Spring 2019, With Ben Affleck Producing |last1=Melrose |first1=Kevin |date=August 9, 2018 |website=[[Comic Book Resources]] |accessdate=August 11, 2018}}{{cite web |last=Prasad |first=R.A |url=https://pursuenews.com/ben-affleck-is-still-on-board-the-batman-movie-as-a-producer/ |title=Ben Affleck Is Still On Board''The Batman'' Movie As A Producer |date=August 9, 2018 |work=PursueNews |accessdate=August 25, 2018}} In September 2018, Reeves completed his draft of the script and submitted it to Warner Bros. for approval.{{cite web|url=https://www.syfy.com/syfywire/report-the-batman-solo-film-chugging-along-with-completed-first-draft|title=Report: The Batman Solo Film Chugging Along With Completed First Draft|last=Oller|first=Jacob|date=September 14, 2018|website=SYFY Wire|accessdate=September 14, 2018}} === Other films in development === Warner Bros. and DC Films have a variety of DCEU films in varying stages of development. * In September 2009, Warner Bros. announced that a film centered around [[Lobo (DC Comics)|Lobo]] was in development. The film underwent direction by [[Guy Ritchie]], followed by [[Brad Peyton]] at different stages in the project's progression.{{cite journal |last=Fleming |first=Mike |url=http://weblogs.variety.com/bfdealmemo/2009/09/ritchie-locked-for-lobo.html?nid=2854 |title=Ritchie Locked for Lobo |journal=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=September 2, 2009 |accessdate=September 2, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090905010138/http://weblogs.variety.com/bfdealmemo/2009/09/ritchie-locked-for-lobo.html?nid=2854 |archivedate=September 5, 2009 |df=mdy-all}}{{cite web |last=Fleming Jr |first=Mike |url=http://deadline.com/2012/04/warner-bros-sets-brad-peyton-to-helm-lobo-the-dc-comics-alien-bounty-hunter-259476/ |title=Warner Bros Sets Brad Peyton To Helm 'Lobo', The DC Comics Alien Bounty Hunter |date=April 20, 2012 |accessdate=April 3, 2018 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]}} Originally intended to star Dwayne Johnson as the main character,http://www.digitalspy.com/movies/news/a393578/lobo-casting-rumours-are-true-confirms-dwayne-johnson/https://screenrant.com/lobo-movie-brad-peyton-2015/ after various iterations, Jason Fuchs was hired as screenwriter.{{cite web |last=Sneider |first=Jeff |url=http://www.thewrap.com/wbs-lobo-lands-wonder-woman-writer-jason-fuchs-exclusive/ |title=Warner Bros' 'Lobo' Lands 'Wonder Woman' Writer Jason Fuchs |date=March 16, 2016 |accessdate=March 29, 2018 |work=[[TheWrap]]}} By February 2018, it was announced that Warner Bros. is courting [[Michael Bay]] to direct the film. Fuchs is rewriting the script, as Bay advised some changes so that the budget can be considerably lowered.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/lobo-movie-will-michael-bay-direct-1083170 |title=Warner Bros. Wants Michael Bay for 'Lobo' — But at the Right Budget |date=February 8, 2018 |accessdate=April 9, 2018 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} * In January 2013, [[Guillermo del Toro]] confirmed that he was working on a film based on the [[Justice League Dark]] team.{{cite web |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2013/01/07/guillermo-del-toro-talks-dark-universe-his-dc-comics-supernatural-heroes-movie |title=Guillermo del Toro Talks Dark Universe, His DC Comics Supernatural Heroes Movie |last=Collura |first=John |work=[[IGN]] |date=January 7, 2013 |accessdate=July 3, 2013}} Del Toro submitted a script in November 2014,{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/markhughes/2014/11/25/exclusive-justice-league-dark-script-in-studio-hands-today/ |title=Exclusive – 'Justice League: Dark' Script In Studio Hands Today |last=Hughes |first=Mark |work=[[Forbes]] |date=November 25, 2014 |accessdate=November 25, 2014}} but was no longer attached to the project by June 2015.{{cite news |last1=Kit |first1=Borys |title=Warner Bros. Moves 'Sandman' to New Line as Part of DC Comics Shuffle |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/warner-bros-moves-sandman-new-805721 |accessdate=July 3, 2015 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=June 29, 2015}} By October of the same year, ''Collider'' reported that the film will follow [[John Constantine|John Constantine / Hellblazer]] as he forms a team of [[supernatural]]-powered heroes to retrieve dangerous books of mysticism.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vTEsjbszRKQ The team will reportedly consist of [[Alec Holland|Alec Holland / Swamp Thing]], [[Zatanna|Zatanna Zatara]], [[Deadman (DC Comics)|Boston Brand / Deadman]], [[Spectre (DC Comics character)|Jim Corrigan / Spectre]], [[Etrigan the Demon|Jason Blood / Etrigan the Demon]], and [[Zatara|Giovanni "John" Zatara]] who will come together to combat the primary antogonist, [[Floronic Man|Jason Woodrue / Floronic Man]].https://www.ign.com/articles/2013/03/31/wondercon-del-toro-talks-justice-league-dark-moviehttp://collider.com/justice-league-dark-details-guillermo-del-toro/https://www.ign.com/articles/2013/03/31/wondercon-del-toro-talks-justice-league-dark-movie By August 2016, [[Doug Liman]] was hired to direct the film, though the following year he left the project due to scheduling conflicts.{{cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/doug-liman-leaves-dark-universe-chaos-walking-1202442185/ |title=Doug Liman Parts Ways With Justice League Dark Movie (Exclusive) |work=Variety |date=May 23, 2017 |accessdate=May 23, 2017}} [[Scott Rudin]] will serve as producer, while Michael Gilio was hired to rewrite the script.{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/doug-liman-justice-league-dark-dc-warner-bros-1201838857/ |title=Doug Liman to Direct 'Dark Universe' for DC, Warner Bros. (Exclusive) |last=Kroll |first=Justin |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=August 24, 2016 |accessdate=August 24, 2016}} In July 2017, the film was titled ''Justice League Dark''. By August 2017, Gerard Johnstone was hired as a co-screenwriter.{{cite web |last=Fleming Jr. |first=Mike |url=http://deadline.com/2017/08/justice-league-dark-gerard-johnstone-andy-muschietti-warner-bros-dc-1202157444/amp/ |title=Warner Bros Gets Gerard Johnstone To Polish ‘Justice League Dark’ Script As Helmer Search Continues |date=August 29, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=October 14, 2017}} * In October 2014, ''Justice League Part Two'' was announced, with Snyder returning as director. In June 2016, it was revealed that ''Justice League'' would be a standalone story, leaving the sequel untitled.{{cite web |last=Coggan |first=Devan |url=http://ew.com/article/2016/06/21/justice-league-one-movie-producer-says/ |title=Justice League just one movie, producer says |date=June 21, 2016 |accessdate=June 6, 2017 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}} Originally scheduled to be released on June 14, 2019, the film was reportedly pushed back to an unspecified date to make room for ''The Batman''.{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/zack-snyder-firming-up-post-justice-league-plans-last-photograph-954812 |title=Zack Snyder Firming Up Post-'Justice League' Plans with 'The Last Photograph' |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |first=Borys |last=Kit |date=December 9, 2016 |accessdate=December 14, 2016}} By October 2017, J. K. Simmons stated that work on the script was in-progress.{{cite web |last=McGloin |first=Matt |url=https://www.cosmicbooknews.com/justice-league-2-development |title=Justice League 2 In Development |date=October 20, 2017 |accessdate=March 29, 2018 |website=Cosmicbooknews.com}} In December of the same year, ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' reported that there were "no immediate plans" for Snyder to direct the sequel.{{cite web |last=Lang |first=Brent |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/dc-films-justice-league-1202632214/amp/ |title=DC Shake-Up After ''Justice League'' Stumbles (EXCLUSIVE) |date=December 7, 2017 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=December 7, 2017}} * In April 2014, [[Ray Fisher (actor)|Ray Fisher]] was cast as [[Cyborg (comics)|Victor Stone / Cyborg]]. The following October, Warner Bros. announced ''Cyborg''. Joe Morton will reprise his role as Dr. Silas Stone.{{cite web |last=Vejoda |first=Jim |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2017/08/10/justice-league-adjusting-the-tone-of-the-cyborg-character-was-part-of-the-reshoots |title=Justice League: Adjusting the tone of the Cyborg character was part of the reshoots |date=August 10, 2017 |accessdate=April 4, 2018 |work=[[IGN]]}} In November 2017, Fisher stated the film will focus specifically on Cyborg,{{cite web |author=Chris Compendio |url=https://screenrant.com/cyborg-intimate-solo-movie/ |title=Cyborg Actor Ray Fisher Wants ‘Intimate Story’ For Solo Movie |website=[[Screen Rant]] |date=November 6, 2017 |accessdate=December 16, 2017}}{{cite web |author=Grant Davis |url=https://heroichollywood.com/justice-league-ray-fisher-cyborg-plans/ |title='Justice League': Ray Fisher Knows Where He'll Play Cyborg Next |website=Heroichollywood.com |date=November 6, 2017 |accessdate=December 16, 2017}} and that the cast and production team will be diverse.{{cite web |last=Davis |first=Brandon |url=http://comicbook.com/dc/2017/11/06/ray-fisher-cyborg-movie-diversity-black-panther-/ |title=Ray Fisher On Importance Of Diversity In 'Cyborg' Movie |website=Comicbook.com |date=November 6, 2017 |accessdate=December 16, 2017}} In August 2018, Morton stated that he believed cut ''Justice League'' scenes involving Cyborg were going to be reworked into ''Cyborg'', though he was not sure when production would begin. Fisher has expressed his desire for Zack Snyder to direct the film. ''Cyborg'' is scheduled to be released on April 3, 2020.{{cite web |last=Topel |first=Fred |url=https://www.slashfilm.com/joe-morton-talks-cyborg-movie/ |title=''Justice League'' Actor Joe Morton Shot More Cyborg Scenes That Could End Up in ''Cyborg'' [Exclusive] |date=August 6, 2018 |work=/Film |accessdate=August 6, 2018}} * In October 2014, Warner Bros. announced a [[Green Lantern]] film. The title was revealed as ''Green Lantern Corps'' in July 2015 at [[San Diego Comic-Con]].{{cite web |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2015/07/11/comic-con-2015-green-lantern-corps-movie-announced |title=Comic Con 2015: Green Lantern Corps Movie Announced |last1=Albert |first1=Brian |date=July 11, 2015 |work=[[IGN]] |accessdate=July 11, 2015}} In January 2017, [[David S. Goyer]] and Justin Rhodes were hired to co-write the screenplay, based on a story draft by Goyer and Geoff Johns, with Goyer also serving as producer. The film was described by the studio as "''[[Lethal Weapon]]'' in space" and will feature [[Hal Jordan]] and [[John Stewart (comics)|John Stewart]] as the main protagonists.{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2017/01/green-lantern-corps-warner-bros-david-goyer-justin-rhodes-dc-1201884133/ |title=Warner Bros Sets David Goyer, Justin Rhodes For Green Lantern Corps |last1=Fleming Jr |first1=Mike |date=January 12, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=January 12, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://comicbook.com/dc/2018/06/11/green-lantern-corps-dc-movie-hal-jordan-and-john-stewart/ |title='Green Lantern Corps' Confirmed to Feature Hal Jordan and John Stewart |last1=Ridgely |first1=Charlie |date=June 11, 2018 |website=ComicBook.com |accessdate=June 11, 2018}} In January 2018, Goyer reaffirmed that the film was still in development despite Warner Bros.'s leadership shakeup.{{cite web |url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/01/09/green-lantern-corps-still-in-the-works-despite-dceu-shakeup-david-goyer-says |title=Green Lantern Corps. 'Still in the Works' Despite DCEU Shakeup, David Goyer Says |last=Barnett |first=Brian |date=January 9, 2018 |website=[[IGN]] |access-date=January 10, 2018}} By June 2018, Geoff Johns was hired to rewrite the film's script in addition to his producing. The story is influenced by his [[New 52]] comics on the Green Lantern Corps.{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/geoff-johns-exiting-as-dc-entertainment-president-1202840461/ |title=Geoff Johns Exiting as DC Entertainment President and Chief Creative Officer |last=Lang |first=Brent |date=June 11, 2018 |publisher=''Variety'' |accessdate=June 11, 2018}} In October of the same year, [[Christopher McQuarrie]] confirmed that he has had discussions with the studio regarding directing the film.{{cite web |url=https://screenrant.com/green-lantern-corps-director-christopher-mcquarrie/ |title=Green Lantern Corps: Christopher McQuarrie Explains Why He Isn't Directing |last=Hood |first=Cooper |date=October 2, 2018 |website=ScreenRant |access-date=October 4, 2018}} ''Green Lantern Corps'' is scheduled to be released in North America on July 24, 2020. * Starting in October 2014, a sequel to ''Man of Steel'' was in development. In November 2016, Amy Adams stated that work had begun on the screenplay.{{cite web |url=http://www.cbr.com/amy-adams-confirms-man-of-steel-2-script-is-in-the-works/ |title=Amy Adams Confirms Man of Steel 2 Script is 'in the Works' |website=[[Comic Book Resources]] |last=Melrose |first=Kevin |date=November 6, 2016 |accessdate=March 29, 2018}} By September 2017, [[Matthew Vaughn]] confirmed he had met with the studio to direct the film.{{cite web |last=Lyus |first=Jon |date=September 15, 2017 |url=https://www.heyuguys.com/matthew-vaughn-superman-director/ |title=Exclusive:Matthew Vaughn Confirms Talks For The Next Superman Film |publisher=''HeyUGuys'' |accessdate=May 16, 2018}} In June 2018, Cavill revealed that he is preparing to reprise the role.{{cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BkFhYa4lkzC/|title=Henry Cavill on Instagram: “Working on the Super Buns! Whiiiiiiich if you vote for me in the Teen Choice Awards (link in bio) and I end up winning then you may or may…”|website=Instagram|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} * By September 2015, a team-up film with [[Booster Gold|Michael Jon Carter / Booster Gold]] and [[Blue Beetle|Theodore "Ted" Kord / Blue Beetle]] was being developed by Greg Berlanti. [[Zak Penn]] worked on a script during the project's early stages.{{cite web|last=Allen|first=Clark|url=http://www.tracking-board.com/exclusive-warner-bros-developing-booster-goldblue-beetle-movie-with-greg-berlanti-helming/|title={Exclusive} Warner Bros. developing Booster Gold/Blue Beetle Movie with Berlanti helming|date=September 17, 2015|website=Tracking-board.com|accessdate=April 5, 2018}} By May 2016, after varying iterations of the project, [[Zack Stentz]] was hired to write a new script for the film which will focus primarily on Booster Gold.{{cite web |last=Rose |first=Lacey |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/features/flash-arrow-producer-greg-berlanti-892417 |title=TV Producer of the Year Greg Berlanti: "I Still Fight About Everything" |date=May 12, 2016 |accessdate=April 5, 2018 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} * In March 2016, ''Suicide Squad 2'' was announced to be in development.{{cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/will-smith-david-ayer-bright-suicide-squad-1201696226/ |title=Will Smith, David Ayer Reteaming on Max Landis Spec 'Bright' |work=Variety |date=March 2, 2016 |accessdate=May 7, 2017}} The following year, [[Adam Cozad]] was hired to write the script, with additional contributions provided by Zak Penn.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/suicide-squad-2-lands-legend-tarzan-writer-986284 |title='Suicide Squad 2' Lands 'Legend of Tarzan' Writer (Exclusive) |date=March 15, 2017 |accessdate=May 4, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}}{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/suicide-squad-2-shallows-director-frontrunner-direct-1020207 |title='Suicide Squad 2': 'The Shallows' Helmer Frontrunner to Direct |date=July 11, 2017 |accessdate=July 11, 2017 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} By September 2017, [[Gavin O'Connor (director)|Gavin O'Connor]] was hired as director, as well as co-screenwriter with Anthony Tambakis, [[David Bar Katz]] and [[Todd Stashwick]].{{cite web |last1=Galuppo |first1=Mia |last2=Kit |first2=Borys |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/gavin-oconnor-direct-suicide-squad-2-1036035 |title=Gavin O'Connor to Direct ''Suicide Squad 2'' |date=September 6, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=December 24, 2017}}{{cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/suicide-squad-2-gavin-oconnor-writer-director-1202549203/amp/ |title=''Suicide Squad 2'': Gavin O’Connor to Write and Direct Sequel |date=September 6, 2017 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=December 24, 2017}}{{cite web |last1=Kit |first1=Borys |last2=Couch |first2=Aaron |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/suicide-squad-2-gets-new-writers-sequel-1118407 |title=''Suicide Squad 2'' Gets New Writers |date=June 8, 2018 |publisher=''The Hollywood Reporter'' |accessdate=June 8, 2018}} The final draft of the script was completed in October 2018, though O'Connor left the project due to scheduling conflicts. Production was placed on hold as Warner Bros. believed the script was too similar to ''Birds of Prey''.http://collider.com/suicide-squad-2-gavin-oconnor-not-directing/{{cite web|url=https://discussingfilm.wordpress.com/2018/09/15/todd-stashwick-talks-12-monkeys-kim-possible-suicide-squad-2-more-exclusive/|title=Todd Stashwick Talks ‘12 Monkeys’, ‘Kim Possible’, ‘Suicide Squad 2 & More. (EXCLUSIVE)|date=September 15, 2018|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}}{{cite web |author=Sandy Schaefer |url=https://screenrant.com/suicide-squad-2-production-start-2018/ |title=Suicide Squad 2 Production Start Set for 2018 |website=Screen Rant |date=December 11, 2017 |accessdate=December 16, 2017}}{{cite web |last=Marc |first=Christopher |url=https://thegww.com/update-will-smith-sets-production-schedules-for-bad-boys-for-life-and-bright-2-as-suicide-squad-2-is-delayed/ |title=UPDATE: WILL SMITH SETS PRODUCTION SCHEDULES FOR ''BAD BOYS FOR LIFE'' AND ''BRIGHT 2'' AS ''SUICIDE SQUAD 2'' IS DELAYED |date=August 18, 2018 |work=OmegaUnderground |publisher=''TheGWW'' |accessdate=August 20, 2018}} [[Charles Roven]], [[Michael De Luca]], Geoff Johns, Zack Snyder, Deborah Snyder, Richard Suckle, [[Dan Lin]] and Andy Horwitz will produce the film, while [[James Gunn]] will write a new script with intentions of also serving as director.{{cite web |last1=Kroll |first1=Justin |title='Suicide Squad 2': Michael De Luca Joins Charles Roven on Producer Team |url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/suicide-squad-2-michael-de-luca-1202645015/ |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=January 11, 2018 |accessdate=January 11, 2018}} {{cite web|last=Flameing Jr|first=Mike|url=https://deadline.com/2018/10/james-gunn-boards-suicide-squad-2-to-write-and-possibly-direct-1202479455/|title=James Gunn Boards ''Suicide Squad 2'' To Write And Possibly Direct|date=October 9, 2018|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|accessdate=October 9, 2018}}{{cite web|last1=Gonzalez|first=Umberto|last2=Verhoeven|first2=Beatrice|url=https://www.thewrap.com/james-gunn-suicide-squad-2-for-dc/|title=James Gunn in Talks to Write ''Suicide Squad 2'' for DC, Eyed to Direct (Exclusive)|date=October 9, 2018|work=TheWrap|accessdate=October 9, 2018}}{{cite web|last=Prasad|first=R.A|url=https://pursuenews.com/suicide-squad-2-director-zack-snyder-geoff-johns-reportedly-on-producer-team/|title=''Suicide Squad 2'': Director Zack Snyder & Geoff Johns Reportedly On Producer Team|date=October 11, 2018|work=PursueNews|accessdate=October 11, 2018}} * ''Gotham City Sirens'', based on the team [[Gotham City Sirens|of the same name]],{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/gotham-city-sirens-movie-david-ayer-margot-robbie-reteam-all-female-dc-villains-project- |title=David Ayer, Margot Robbie Reteam for All-Female DC Villains Movie 'Gotham City Sirens' (Exclusive) |work=The Hollywood Reporter |last=Kit |first=Borys |date=December 13, 2016 |accessdate=May 9, 2017}} was announced to be in development starting in December 2016. David Ayer signed on as director/co-producer from a script by [[Geneva Robertson-Dworet]]. The team will consist of Harley Quinn, [[Catwoman|Selina Kyle / Catwoman]], and [[Poison Ivy (character)|Pamela Isley / Poison Ivy]].{{cite tweet |number=808859034463764484 |user=DavidAyerMovies |title=#Sirens4ever |author=David Ayer |date=December 13, 2016 |access-date=October 4, 2018}} Margot Robbie will reprise her role from ''Suicide Squad'' and take the role of an executive producer, while Geoff Johns and Jon Berg will serve as producers on the project.{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/gotham-city-sirens-movie-david-ayer-margot-robbie-reteam-all-female-dc-villains-project-|title=David Ayer, Margot Robbie Reteam for All-Female DC Villains Movie 'Gotham City Sirens' (Exclusive)|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} Production was originally scheduled to begin in mid-2017, but following the restructuring of DC Films leadership the film's development was placed on hold in favor of ''Birds of Prey''.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/markhughesfilms/status/811995249887289344|title=Mark Hughes on Twitter|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/harley-quinn-movie-r-rated-margot-robbie/#cathy-yan|title=The Harley Quinn Spinoff Might Be an "R-Rated Girl Gang Film," Says Margot Robbie|date=May 8, 2018|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} In August 2017, Leto was confirmed to reprise his role as the Joker.{{cite web|url=https://screenrant.com/joker-jared-leto-suicide-squad-2-gotham-city-sirens/|title=Joker Expected in Suicide Squad 2 & Gotham City Sirens|date=August 22, 2017|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} Despite a busy production schedule on other films,{{cite web|url=https://www.cinemablend.com/news/2440139/david-ayer-is-teaming-up-with-shia-labeouf-for-a-crime-thriller|title=David Ayer Is Teaming Up With Shia LaBeouf For A Crime Thriller|date=June 23, 2018|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} Ayer has continued to be involved with the development of the project, meeting with the team's creator [[Paul Dini]] in August 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.christianpost.com/news/director-david-ayer-debunks-rumors-suggesting-gotham-city-sirens-is-dead-211369/|title=Director David Ayer Debunks Rumors Suggesting 'Gotham City Sirens' Is Dead|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://screenrant.com/suicide-squad-david-ayer-gotham-city-sirens-paul-dini/|title=Suicide Squad Director Meets With Gotham City Sirens Creator|date=August 2, 2018|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} * By December 2016, ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' noted that a film centered around [[Deadshot|Floyd Lawton / Deadshot]] was in development. By September 2018, [[Will Smith]] confirmed that he would reprise his role from ''Suicide Squad'', and reported that the studio is still developing the story.https://batman-news.com/2018/09/27/will-smith-deadshot-movie-talks-confirmed/http://www.digitalspy.com/movies/suicide-squad/news/a867104/deadshot-solo-movie-suicide-squad-will-smith/ * In February 2017, a film centered on [[Nightwing|Dick Grayson / Nightwing]] was in development, with [[Chris McKay]] and [[Bill Dubuque]] signed on as director and screenwriter, respectively.{{cite web |last=Ford |first=Rebecca |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/warner-bros-plotting-nightwing-movie-lego-batman-movie-director-978737 |title=Warner Bros. Plotting Live-Action 'Nightwing' Movie With 'Lego Batman Movie' Director (Exclusive) |date=February 23, 2017 |accessdate=April 3, 2018 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} The film will focus on Grayson's origins, as well as his later vigilante career. In February 2018, McKay stated the script was nearing its final draft.{{cite web |last=Dumarang |first=Ana |url=https://screenrant.com/nightwing-movie-script-casting-update/ |title=Nightwing Movie Script Will Be Finished Soon |date=February 9, 2018 |website=[[Screen Rant]] |accessdate=March 13, 2018}} * After years of previously being attached to other DC projects, [[Dwayne Johnson]] was cast in September 2014 to portray [[Black Adam|Teth-Adam / Black Adam]] in the DC Films shared universe.https://variety.com/2014/film/news/dwayne-johnson-to-play-black-adam-in-shazam-darren-lemke-to-script-exclusive-1201294338/http://www.digitalspy.com/movies/news/a393578/lobo-casting-rumours-are-true-confirms-dwayne-johnson/ Initially set to be introduced in ''[[Shazam! (film)|Shazam!]]'', by January 2017 the production studios involved divided the narrative of [[Captain Marvel (DC Comics)|William "Billy" Batson / Shazam]] and Black Adam in order to focus on the latter's superhero origin, and downfall into villainy. Johnson, who will also serve as a producer on the film, has stated the two characters will cross paths in another movie.http://www.mtv.com/news/3001670/the-rock-black-adam-movie-dc/ By October 2017, [[Adam Sztykiel]] was hired as the screenwriter.{{cite web |url=http://www.tracking-board.com/undateable-creator-adam-sztykiel-to-write-dwayne-johnsons-black-adam-movie-for-dc-new-line-exclusive/ |title="Undateable" Creator Adam Sztykiel to Write Dwayne Johnson’s "Black Adam" Movie for DC, New Line (Exclusive) |last=Sneider |first=Jeff |date=October 31, 2017 |website=Tracking-board.com |accessdate=March 29, 2018}} The plot will follow the character as he fights for freedom from slavery, to protect his people as an anti-hero in ancient [[Kahndaq]].https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FH_S_RjT8bk Co-producer Hiram Garcia stated the film will be gritty and violent, similar to the character's source material.{{cite web |last=Chitwood |first=Adam |url=http://collider.com/black-adam-movie-update-dwayne-johnson/#images |title=Exclusive: ''Black Adam'' Producer Hiram Garcia Gives Update on Dwayne Johnson’s DC Film |date=August 28, 2018 |work=Collider |accessdate=August 30, 2018}} In April 2017, Dwayne Johnson announced that the script involves appearances from other [[DC Comics]] superheroes.http://www.filmstarts.de/nachrichten/18519804.htmlhttps://screenrant.com/black-adam-dwayne-johnson-dc-cameos-filming-start/ Production will begin with principal photography slated for late-2019.{{cite web |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/dwayne-johnson-vows-dcs-black-adam-coming-soon-172807660.html |title=Dwayne Johnson vows that DC's 'Black Adam' is coming soon |last=Alter |first=Ethan |date=April 10, 2018 |website=[[Yahoo!]] |accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://screenrant.com/black-adam-movie-filming-start-date/ |title=Dwayne Johnson’s Black Adam Movie Aiming for 2019 Filming Start |last=Mithaiwala |first=Mansoor |date=April 10, 2018 |website=[[Screen Rant]] |accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://thegww.com/dwayne-johnsons-black-adam-now-eyeing-production-start-next-fall/ |title=DWAYNE JOHNSON’S ''BLACK ADAM'' NOW EYEING PRODUCTION START NEXT FALL |last=Marc |first=Christopher |date=August 1, 2018 |work=Omega Underground |accessdate=August 1, 2018}} * By March 2017, [[Joss Whedon]] was hired to write, direct and produce a film centered around [[Barbara Gordon|Barbara Gordon / Batgirl]].{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/batgirl-movie-joss-whedon-warner-bros-1202018544/ |title='Batgirl' Movie: Joss Whedon to Direct Standalone Film |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |first=Dave |last=McNary |date=March 30, 2017 |accessdate=March 30, 2017}} Whedon was to begin production on the film in 2018,{{cite AV media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NDjmJAHpSnw&t=52m59s |title=San Diego Comic Con 2017: Exclusive Access & Interviews – IGN Live |date=July 21, 2017 |accessdate=July 22, 2017 |time=52:59 |author=[[IGN]] |website=[[YouTube]]}} but stepped down in February 2018.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/joss-whedon-exits-batgirl-movie-1087384 |title=Joss Whedon Exits 'Batgirl' Movie (Exclusive) |date=February 22, 2018 |accessdate=April 4, 2018 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} In April 2018, after impressing the studio with her work on ''Birds of Prey'', Hodson was hired as screenwriter for ''Batgirl''.{{cite web |last=Kit |first=Borys |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/batgirl-movie-back-bumblebee-writer-1101078 |title='Batgirl' Movie Back On, Now With 'Bumblebee' Writer (Exclusive) |date=April 9, 2018 |accessdate=April 9, 2018 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}} Warner Bros. is actively looking for a female director to replace Whedon.{{cite web |first=Mansoor |last=Mithaiwala |url=https://screenrant.com/warner-bros-batgirl-female-director-whedon/ |title=Warner Bros. Wants a Female Director for DC's Batgirl Movie |date=February 22, 2018 |website=[[Screen Rant]] |accessdate=March 13, 2018}} * In July 2017, an untitled film centered around Harley Quinn and the Joker was announced to be in development, with a working title of ''Harley Quinn vs The Joker'', which was scheduled to begin production after ''Suicide Squad 2''.{{cite web|url=https://screenrant.com/harley-quinn-vs-joker-movie-spinoff/|title=Warner Bros. is Developing Harley Quinn vs The Joker Spinoff|date=July 21, 2017|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/joker-harley-quinn-movie-scores-crazy-stupid-love-filmmakers-write-direct-1032210|title=Joker and Harley Quinn Movie Coming from 'Crazy Stupid Love' Filmmakers (Exclusive)|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} Filmmaking duo [[Glenn Ficarra]] and [[John Requa]] will co-write/direct/produce the project.{{cite web |url=https://screenrant.com/margot-robbie-praises-joker-harley-quinn-movie-directors/ |title=Margot Robbie Praises Joker & Harley Quinn Movie Directors |last=Stowe |first=Dusty |date=September 19, 2017 |website=ScreenRant |access-date=October 4, 2018}} In September 2018, Ficarra and Requa announced the script was completed and submitted to Warner Bros. stating that production will start after ''Birds of Prey'' is completed. The story will explore the toxic relationship of the characters, combining the tones of the Ficarra and Requa's previous collaborative work on ''[[Bad Santa]]'' and ''[[This Is Us (TV series)|This Is Us]]''.{{cite web|url=https://www.metro.us/entertainment/movies/the-joker-and-harley-quinn-spin-off-update|title=The Joker and Harley Quinn spin-off’s writers talk us through their 'deranged' mash-up of 'Bad Santa' and 'This Is Us'|date=September 20, 2018|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} * In October 2017, a film centered around [[Deathstroke|Slade Wilson / Deathstroke]] was announced, following a story pitch to the studio by [[Gareth Evans (director)|Gareth Evans]]. Warner Bros. has had discussions with Evans to write/direct the film, though by the following year he has reportedly not yet been contractually attached to the project.{{cite web|url=https://comicbook.com/dc/2018/10/03/deathstroke-gareth-evans-the-raid-joe-manganiello/|title='The Raid' Director Clarifies 'Deathstroke' Reports, Praises Joe Manganiello|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}}{{cite web |last1=Gonzalez |first1=Umberto |title='The Raid' Vet Gareth Evans in Talks to Direct DC Comics 'Deathstroke' Film (Exclusive) |url=https://www.thewrap.com/gareth-evans-dc-comics-deathstroke/ |work=[[TheWrap]] |accessdate=October 25, 2017}} * In March 2018, a film about the [[New Gods]], an alien race introduced in ''Justice League'', was in development with [[Ava DuVernay]] signed on as director. [[Kario Salem]] wrote a story treatment with DuVernay, while Warner Bros. searches for a screenwriter.{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/ava-duvernay-superhero-movie-new-gods-dc-1202725043/ |title=Ava DuVernay to Direct DC's Superhero Epic 'New Gods' |last=McNary |first=Dave |date=March 15, 2018 |work=Variety |accessdate=March 29, 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://deadline.com/2018/03/ava-duvernay-new-gods-movie-warner-bros-dc-jack-kirby-1202338680/ |title=Ava DuVernay To Direct Jack Kirby Comic Creation ‘The New Gods’ For Warner Bros, DC |last1=Patten |first1=Dominic |last2=Fleming Jr |first2=Mike |date=March 15, 2018 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=March 29, 2018}} * In June 2018, a film centered around the Joker entered early development.{{efn|Not to be confused with the 2019 film ''[[Joker (2019 film)|Joker]]'', which is set outside the DCEU.}} Leto will serve as an executive producer in addition to reprising his role as the Joker. Warner Bros. intends for the film to "pave the way" for all other ''Suicide Squad''-related projects. Leto will also be involved with hiring the film's production crew.{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/joker-jared-leto-standalone-movie-warner-bros-1202831025/ |title=Jared Leto’s Joker Is Getting His Own Movie (EXCLUSIVE) |work=Variety |last=Kroll |first=Justin |date=June 5, 2018 |accessdate=June 11, 2018}} * By August 2018, a film centered around [[Supergirl|Kara Zor-El / Supergirl]], was announced to be in development with Oren Uziel penning the script.{{cite web |last=Fleming Jr. |first=Mike |url=https://deadline.com/2018/08/supergirl-movie-warner-bros-dc-comics-universe-oren-uziel-script-superman-1202440687 |title=''Supergirl'' Movie On Drawing Board For Warner Bros/DC; Oren Uziel Scripting |date=August 6, 2018 |work=Deadline |accessdate=August 6, 2018}}{{cite web |last1=Galuppo |first=Mia |last2=McMillan |first2=Graeme |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/supergirl-movie-oren-uziel-write-script-warner-bros-1132421 |title=''Supergirl'' Movie in the Works with ''22 Jump Street'' Writer |date=August 6, 2018 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=August 6, 2018}} Warner Bros. is seeking a female director, with [[Reed Morano]]—who has expressed interest in the project—being its top choice.{{cite web|url=http://www.film-news.co.uk/news/UK/57477/Reed-Morano-circling-Supergirl-movie|title=Reed-Morano-circling-Supergirl-movie|publisher=film-news.co.uk|date=28 August 2018|accessdate=7 September 2018}}{{cite web |last=Busch |first=Anita |url=https://deadline.com/2018/08/female-director-scorecard-warner-bros-superhero-wonder-woman-1202441259/ |title=Female Director Scorecard: Warner Bros Lining Up Its Superheroes |date=August 13, 2018 |work=Deadline |accessdate=August 26, 2018}}{{cite web |last=Marc |first=Christopher |url=https://thegww.com/reed-morano-is-on-the-top-of-wbs-wish-list-to-direct-the-new-supergirl-movie/ |title=EXCLUSIVE: REED MORANO IS ON THE TOP OF WB’S WISH-LIST TO DIRECT ''SUPERGIRL'' |date=August 25, 2018 |work=OmegaUnderground |accessdate=August 26, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/peter-dinklage-elle-fanning-think-reed-morano-should-direct-wbs-supergirl-1143275|title=Peter Dinklage, Elle Fanning Think Reed Morano Should Direct WB's 'Supergirl'|publisher=|accessdate=October 4, 2018}} * By November 2018, a [[Jaime Reyes|Jaime Reyes / Blue Beetle]] was in development. Gareth Dunnet-Alcocer will serve as screenwriter, while Zev Foreman will executive produce the project.{{Cite news|url=https://www.thewrap.com/jaime-reyes-blue-beetle-latino-superhero/|title=DC and WB Developing Jaime Reyes 'Blue Beetle' Latino Superhero Movie|date=2018-12-01|work=TheWrap|access-date=2018-12-02|language=en-US}} == Recurring principal cast and characters == {{further|List of DC Extended Universe cast members}}
{{quotation|{{center|'''List indicator(s)'''}}}} This table only includes characters that have appeared in multiple DCEU films. * A dark grey cell indicates the character was not in the film, or that the character's presence in the film has not yet been announced. * An {{note label|archive|A|}} indicates an appearance through archival footage or photographic stills. * A {{note label|cameo|C|}} indicates a cameo appearance. * An {{note label|extended|E|}} indicates an appearance not included in the theatrical cut of the film. * A {{note label|photograph|P|}} indicates a new appearance in onscreen photographs only. * A {{note label|special effects|S|}} indicates the character appears through use of special effects only. * A {{note label|unaccredited|U|}} indicates an uncredited appearance. * A {{note label|young|Y|}} indicates an appearance by an actor portraying a younger version of a character.
